Ricky from the bell service was so friendly and accommodating that he answered all our queries about nearby restaurants. He ushered us to the lounge, too. We didn't expect the continental breakfast to be that nice. The cocktails/snacks served between 5-7pm was sumptuous that we were not able to eat dinner anymore. Loved the freshly baked cookies, as well, with the tea of our choice. The free airport shuttle added to its value for money. Although, the package could have been sweetened with a free in-room wifi. Overall, we had a great stay and would consider this hotel on our next visit and will recommend it to our family and friends visiting San Francisco.

review.title: Good but lacking in small measure
review.reviewText:
Stayed 4 nights.  Room comfortable in a sort of retro 60s style which I liked.  Bathroom large but could be updated (little shelf space).  I had to ask for a footstool for chair as these are shown in photos of standard rooms.  Breakfast choice very good.  Restaurant served good and reasonably priced menus.  Surprised the room didn't have glasses but only cheap plastic cups.  When I raised this at reception they said that one can ask for glassware.  Reception failed to tell me about the free wifi.  It appears that there is a charge for this but I received free wifi.

The hotel offers a free Shuttle to SFO airport and I took the BART (metro) into the city each day.  Very easy but the journey may take about 45 minutes.  There is a direct line to  Powell, Montgomery, Civic Center and Embarcadero stations.  Better I thought than driving in and finding parking.

Altogether a pleasant stay with only a few very minor grumbles.  The hotel is situated by the bay and there is a nice jogging track nearby.  Didn't use the indoor pool or excercise room.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms could be updated, although adequate.  They should tell you about the complimentary Internet.

review.title: Unreliable Shuttle Service to SFO
review.reviewText:
Their airport shuttle is not reliable transportation to SFO--have a backup plan.  As instructed by the front desk, we reserved (through the front desk) our airport shuttle because we needed a 3am pickup, which is before the regular route begins.  The shuttle arrived early, and it was so full it left eight Hilton guests with shuttle reservations behind.  The next regularly scheduled shuttle stop was an hour later.  The front desk staff responded with a shrug of their shoulders and only after some heated arguments did they bother to call cabs.  They never offered to reimburse us.

Hilton's airport shuttle system is more like the city buses -- first come first served, arrive whenever, reservations not honored or recorded, so get in line early and plan for lots of extra time.  With all that hassle, might as well stay at a cheaper and nicer hotel further out and take a cab.
review.negativeRemarks: unreliable shuttle service to SFO

Accommodations were nice, food at restaurant was excellent, service was a little slow, they seemed understaffed, but we did have a large group with us. Gym facility was great. Executive lounge was awesome, worth the extra $10-20. Free breakfast and evening snacks and beverages. Staff in the executive lounge were excellent, very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Flintstone hotel
review.reviewText: From the get go, I called the hotel to confirm they had HDMI compatible tv's in the room because this was a MAJOR concern for me. The staff told me yes, they'd be able to accommodate me. So I check in and see a dinosaur in our bedroom. This TV doesn't support HDMI cables. I asked the staff about it and they said they were booked all night. Understandable. Then they told me if I wanted a room with an HDMI TV it would be an extra charge. When I checked into the room, there were used up towels in the restroom, the room didn't have toilet paper, the room was rather dirty, there wasn't a fridge, no microwave, and the AC didn't blow cold air at all. I've stayed in motel 6's with better accommodation and amenities than this hotel. To claim it's a Hilton hotel is a complete slap in the face to the name. Oh, and this hotel charges for parking, even if you don't Park a car there and when you try and complain about it, they say there's nothing they could do about it because their gate wasn't working. How the hell are you going to charge someone for parking when you don't Park your car there because they're having technical difficulties?!? This hotel is a mickey mouse operation. Do yourself a favor, stay in the doubletree by Hilton.

review.title: Okay hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: I think we had a discounted rate, so the hotel was okay.  Having to pay for Wi-Fi in the room was surprising, and for some odd reasons, our cell phones had absolutely no service in the hotel.  We were traveling with an infant, so a refrigerator in the room would have been helpful.  The room itself was clean and comfortable, it looked like it was relatively recently renovated. Next time I stay near SFO for an early AM flight, I'll try a different hotel with complimentary wi-fi.
The hotel was very clean, nice and friendly staff.  Would definitely stay again!
review.locationRemarks: Very Close to the airport, perfect for an early morning flight!

review.reviewText: The main downside on this hotel was we had access to the executive lounge on the 15 th floor but it seems so does everyone else and at breakfast time it got extremely busy and one day we had to leave and go back later because we could not find a seat, also the air con was very cold. The free bus to Burlingame was excellent where there were plenty of shops and restaurants, also the Caltrain ran from there to lots of places which we were not told about at reception they did not even have a timetable which would have been very useful. Perhaps a notice board with all the things to do in the area, suggested walks etc. Otherwise excellent would definitely stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was very good, the free bus shuttle to the airport saves the messing about with taxis, also the free bus to Burlingame was excellent.

review.title: Great.....but that parking fee
review.reviewText: I think this hotel is in the perfect location for me. It south of San Francisco so you don't have to worry about the SF traffic unless you're headed up that way. It's near the San Mateo/Hayward bridge so you have easy access the the East Bay. As with most hotels that are 4 star and up, almost everything has a fee. Don't think about opening that bottle of water that they conveniently placed in your room unless you're willing to pay the $3.00 fee. So about this parking thing. This hotel is not in San Francisco where space is sparse. So why are they charging daily for parking? This is the main reason why I changed my stay to just one day and reserve a hotel at another location. The Las Vegas hotel/casinos don't charge for parking. Hmmm.

I think it was worth 200 per night but after 3 days stay (needing the location to visit mom just over the mountain on the coast) I don't think it was worth the $700 and change it cost me. 
But I believe it was within 30 dollars of every other hotel in that area so what are you going to do? Save 100 bucks and stay at the Red Roof? Maybe next time I'll try.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Close to airport but away from the San Francisco city. Main reason we picked this hotel since before booking when I called, they said every 2 hours they have city tour but when we went there, they didn't have the city tour we expected to have at 11.30 AM. Hotel is far away from the city & we got stuck there! Even my family was down waiting, since I came down 2 minutes later; shuttle left us there. Luckily we made it in time for our flight!
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, closer to the airport. Hotel has shuttle every 20 - 30 minutes to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Give a correct information to the customer coming from out of state or country!
review.locationRemarks: Nothing much! Hotel is far away from San Francisco city. Taxi fares are expensive.

review.title: Week end get away for two
review.reviewText: Affordable. We were upgraded to executive so we had access to the daily continental breakfast, coffee, tea and cookies in the evening. This was an easy place for friends to find us, to takes us to all of the San Francisco sights. The staff was friendly and seemed to be having fun working together. We will stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't charge registered guests for parking.
review.locationRemarks: Close and convenient to SFO airport

review.title: Very nice hotel, excellent shuttle service.
review.reviewText: Staff are very welcoming.  Rooms are in excellent condition, overall a very good experience.

review.title: Nice view
review.reviewText: Everything good except the pool the water smells so bad and looks so dirty. The jaccuzzy looks green 😏 I think you do not give a very good maintence to the pool area

review.title: GREAT EXPERIENCE!
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel, the service was great. The continental breakfast for the price we paid was super. The service staff at the guests lounge were very friendly and helpful. There was just a little  lack of information from the front desk staff about the hotel facilities, but this was not a big issue. Thank you!

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much for taking the time to share your stay experience.  I am terribly sorry for difficulty you experienced with the key cards. On a positive note we have updated our key card system  for both the guest rooms and parking gate. 

We hope you give us another chance.

Regards,
John C. Kellites / General Manager

review.title: Nice staffs but hotel needs update
review.reviewText: I had key problem since day one, and I am not the only one. The first key Could not open the room door, but it worked on gate for self parking. New key worked on room door but it did not work on parking gate. We were told they are working on replacing the old system. The manager handled it very professionally, he came to parking lot to ensure that the gate would open. The breakfast buffet was good and all staffs in restaurant are very friendly and helpful. Paul, one of the waiters is so sweet and patient. I watched him helping a senior guest working on toaster and making a tea the way he liked. The room is comfortable but the toilet and bathtub were too close. The bath tissue was much farther away from toilet comparing bathtub, it is a very strange layout.

review.title: Great place to rest up from a long trip.
review.reviewText: VERY comfortable beds, and quiet beautiful room.  No in room refrigerator (which we need for hubby's insulin).  I called and asked if we could get one and they had one brought up in about 2 minutes.  Also had a very nice breakfast buffet.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed and helpfulness of staff.
review.locationRemarks: Right across from the long term parking lot we use when traveling from San Francisco (Anza Lot).

review.reviewText: The night before our departure. Decided to stay close to airport. Very nice hotel and extremely quite rooms. Would stay here again.

review.title: Worked for us
review.reviewText:
The Air Con was very noisy, even set to low. Sounded like earth- moving equipment. Complained on check- out to the usual, "I do apologise..". But no address. We turned it off and opened the window.
Shuttle to airport was unreliable due to closure of freeway; but a resourceful staff member called a taxi for us and we made the flight
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning

review.title: Nice hotel, but...
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself is very good. I think the room rate was reasonable. 
But the driver of free shuttle bus was the worst. He was very roughly-mannered.
review.positiveRemarks: The executive lounge on the 15th floor is very convenient. It supplies a light meal.
review.negativeRemarks: I did not understand why my room was not equipped with a refrigerator. And a peg of the bathtub was broken.
review.locationRemarks: Its location is very good because of the closeness to the airport. You can also enjoy the view of landing airplanes.

review.title: Old Outdated not a Hilton grade hotel or service.
review.reviewText: I was told I booked two separate beds. Possibly I did but serious be a huge mistake on my part. Asked to change to a king bed and told no rooms available but more then half the hotel was dark. After my partner that flew in to spend time with me complained they brought us a key to a new room on the 13th floor. The window was completely blocked. AC so loud. Old dated terrible hotel. When the prior night hotel was cheaper and truly luxury place this was a very sad hotel and terrible experience. Breakfast was missing food and we had to call room service to get them to bring missing items from our in room breakfast. Would not recommend this hotel unless it's a great price. Not dirty. Just old outdated poor service. Like a bad Days Inn for a Hilton price. I think Expedia should seriously look into this hotel.

review.title: Shuttle was convenient.
review.reviewText: It was our last night of a long holiday so we picked one near SFO. However, we felt a little isolated with its location.
review.positiveRemarks: Restaurant had good quality food. Staff were helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The A/C in our room rattled. But more importantly, there should be wifi available in all rooms, not just the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: There is nothing to do nearby. We felt very isolated as we did not have a car. There are no shops nearby, inc any seven eleven type stores.

review.title: Perfect for early flights out of SFO
review.reviewText: The rooms are pretty standard, nothing fancy. No minibar for chilling anything. Bed was comfortable. Well sound-proofed so you don't hear the planes flying directly overhead. The restaurant offers a very nice dinner, reasonably priced, and our waiters were great. The front desk staff wasn't overly helpful, but was fine. We were told there would be coffee available in the lobby in the morning while we waited for the shuttle to take us to the airport - but they didn't mention it cost $3 a cup! Great airport shuttle service.
Nice hotel. Good food at the resteraunt! Nice location with free shuttle to airport!

review.title: They made me and my service dog feel at home
review.reviewText: I was only there for one night to catch a flight at SFO the next morning. The staff really went our of their way to make me and my service dog, Jake, feel at home. Nice hotel and a great area in the back to run your dog.
Pleasant and comfortable stay, I would recommend this hotel to other travelers.

review.title: 2N at Hilton
review.reviewText:
staff is friendly. room is clean and cosy. 

breakfast - we were given the executive lounge breakfast, the place is small and we couldnt find seatings. We ended up  having our first day of breakfast at the lobby. We arrived early for breakfast on the 2nd day. Then we realized the food selection is way less at the executive lounge. Ok, the view is nice, but you can't eat it. 

another thing we felt shortchanged was the parking. We were charged extra $34 for 2 days of parking, all the hotels around the area have complimentary parking. So for visitors driving a car, this is your hidden cost.
review.locationRemarks: Bay Area, lots of stuff to do.

review.title: Nice hotel with a good view of the bay
review.reviewText:
I stayed here with my boyfriend for the weekend. We got a great deal for an executive room that included breakfast and various other foods throughout the day. Breakfast was simple, but suffice. There is no need to pay $20 for breakfast. Front desk people were helpful and mostly friendly. There was one employee that had a frown, at least fake the smile. Other than that, everyone working there were friendly.

The room was standard size and the bed was comfortable.

I would stay here again if there's another good deal.

review.title: picking up my daughter from the airport.
review.reviewText: Nice room and comfortable bed. Restaurants available within a couple of miles. Not over priced parking. Should be free though! :)
Close to the airport with a free airport shuttle. Staff helpful with providing directions.
Nice staff, great view, good breakfast, clean room. We will come back next trip !

photos.caption: Good bayside walking track near hotel.

review.title: Ok for quick overnight stay
review.reviewText: Service in the restaurant could be improved. The food was cold.

review.title: Wonderful place, comfortable stay!
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean and very comfortable. Loved the gym and equipment, and the free breakfast was great well worth the price.

review.title: stressless
review.reviewText: No stress on getting to airport on time.  Hotel staff and driver of shuttle bus were very nice
review.positiveRemarks: The ease and convenience of sleeping and dining all in one. Place
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I can think of

review.title: Minutes from SFO
review.reviewText: Great spot from which to take off from SFO.  Real nice hotel, fitness center, on-site dining, or walking distance to excellent dining/bar options.  Great bay views, fair price.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Pretty good hotel and great food.
review.reviewText: Pretty nice hotel. They just have to update the shower area, change the dirty carpet in the lobby in front of the elevators, and have a little faster service in the restaurants.

review.title: Great hotel, loved the breakfast!
review.reviewText: The room and beds were fanatastic, the tabs were a little glitchy but worked most of the time! the breakfast on the 15 floor was very nice and filling! But overall the stay was goo

review.title: The staff was outstanding.
review.reviewText:
We reserved two rooms, and one of our guests was in a wheel chair.  So, the staff made sure that the rooms were near each other.  She also made sure one bed was lower than the other.  

Second, during breakfast, the room was full but the staff new that our group wanted to sit together.  So, they opened up the bar area for all of us to dine.

Third, we checked out and forgot our sweaters.  We called, and when we returned, a lady had our sweaters.

Fourth, I discovered I forgot my Bluetooth.  Once again, when I returned, they had my Bluetooth head phone.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpet near the lobby elevator had a bunch of skid marks.

review.title: Had a nice time visiting San Francisco for the can
review.reviewText: Everyone treat me with respect and made me feel as if I was back at home relieve enjoyed my stay here

review.title: Great hotel by the SF Airport!
review.reviewText: Room was spotless, bed was wonderful, front desk staff was very helpful, beautiful lobby, fabulous Expedia price! Would definitely stay here again!!
It was a very nice hotel and the room what's nice a big ! Loved it . Even though it was close to the airport it wasn't loud at all

review.title: Nice Hotel, on the Bay
review.reviewText: The location was good, not too far from the city, the bay is quite pretty. Very upset however that even though I booked a BayView room, the room I was placed in could only see a tiny sliver of the bay and only if you stood at the window and looked way at the edge. Also, the tv signal kept cutting in and out. The staff was courteous, however no one asked me how my stay was, but that is just a minor thing. Overall I would probably book here again, but I would definitely call ahead to make sure they actually have a bayview if that is what I booked.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-Fi is $10 a day, wish I could have just bought half a day.
review.locationRemarks: Stanford Shopping center is about 20 minutes, 30 minutes to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you sharing the feedback regarding our   shuttle service.  Our complimentary airport shuttle service is scheduled for pickups every 20 minutes and we make every effort to ensure this schedule is consistently followed. After 1am we do require a phone call to dispatch the shuttle we apologize for the lack of response. 

I do hope you will come back and see us again soon.  My team and I would welcome the opportunity to transform your experience.  

Regards,
John C. Kellites / General Manager

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: Hotel shuttle service from the airport was none waited almost an hour and took a taxi at 1am after calling them 3 times there was about at least an other 20 people waiting.

review.title: Good hotel near airport
review.reviewText: Stayed here because of the ease to the airport. They have a shuttle that comes every 15-20 minutes.
Overall very good place for short stay at SF. The front desk was friendly and bellman was nice as well.

review.title: Adequate for overnight stay
review.reviewText: This hotel offers adequate service. There is nothing special, or distinctive however. The restaurant offers minimal choices in seating and menu. Prices are on the high side. Transportation to the airport is good. Bed was very comfortable.

review.title: Very nice hotel with view of the San Francisco Bay
review.reviewText: We had a little problem with the TV and called the concierge about it and the technician came up to our room in a heartbeat. The room is very nice, the beds are comfortable, nice air conditioning and most of all free buffet breakfast! With lots of choices to choose from! I would stay in this hotel again next time I visit San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: I love everything about this hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Did not really had a chance to explore around but I know there's a lot of restaurants nearby.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Very comfortable bed. Sheets are nice and soft. They even have peterthomasroth products for free. Everything was clean and updated.
Very comfortable.  However, the furniture left something to be desired.
review.negativeRemarks: Update room 929... the furniture is a bit outdated...
review.locationRemarks: LOVED the location!

review.title: Hotel 30 min from the City, no public transport.
review.reviewText: Everything was great except annoying servers in the restaurants, breathing on my back every single minute, hoping for a few extra dollars. I appreciate help but not an annoyance when I have no time chew my food answering those sweet Asian employees (with all due respect) that I am fine and do not need refill of coffee every 2 minutes!

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: What a nice surprise to be right there on the water.  Great walking paths too.  Although near the airport, there wasn't much noise from the planes at all.  The hotel provides shuttle/trolley if you want to go into the cute town of Burlingame to shop or eat. I think the only complaint- would be the size of the bed- a double feels quite small.  Not sure why they wouldn't put queens in at least.
Very hospitable staff. Extremely clean and comfortable!

review.title: Loud AC
review.reviewText: The only negative is that the AC unit was so loud we slept terrible.
review.negativeRemarks: AC unit upgrade or repair

review.title: Very clean, nice staff
review.reviewText: We were only there for a short time between spending the day in San Francisco and catching an early flight the next morning. Everyone was extremely helpful and our room was clean and comfy.

review.title: SFO local business stay
review.reviewText: Being my second week of business here at SFO I loved this hotel. Clean, friendly staff, good location. Nice park area surrounding hotel with a few other restaurants fairly close.

review.title: Relaxing overnight stay
review.reviewText:
Me and my boyfriend just wanted a little time to ourselves,  so I looked on expedia and found this super deal for Hilton. The price was a steal.
We got there late, the staff was really nice and pleasant and also changed our bed from a queen to a king aize. We loved the stay. It was very peaceful and quiet! Relaxation accomplished!

review.title: Treated really well
review.reviewText: The manager answered my prearrival queries really helpfully. When we had an issue one of the staff was excellent at resolving and ensured we were satisfied. We had a great experience here. The executive level is fabulous but....probably a quite contentious view...I don't think it's appropriate to have children and buggies in the Executive lounge. Too crowded and not then conduisive to peace or business.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the executive level. Loved being able to walk round the park area surrounding.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast food wasn't hot
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to San Francisco, to the airport and a great little park to walk around if you don't want to drive after dinner.

review.title: Nice hotel , comfortable.
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful experience , the hotel beds are comfortable, the people work there is so nice always try to help u.  The hotel give u a complementary snacks and they are good.! We get nice shuttle to the airport. Nice place to stay!

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: Stayed for 2 nights. Hotel was clean, staff was friendly and the location was convenient. The only minor complaint was that the fan/ac was a little loud but nothing that was a deal breaker. I would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean. Great location near freeway and restaurants are near-by
review.negativeRemarks: Quieter fans/ac would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: plenty of choices to eat nearby. downtown burlingame is close by for shopping too.

review.title: Not so good
review.reviewText:
Arrived and went to hotel food area, 10 people in area and it took 15 minutes to get the 1 bartender to serve us.  ALl the while more and more guests were coming in...she said the rest of  staff was in a meeting.  Our food came out in decent time but 1 item was stone cold and had to be redone.  As Rome was burning , hotel management (3 of the, separately) was in the next booth over interviewing somebody oblivious to how the lounge was going down in flames.  Finally a relief server came in to help the poor bartender out...he told me there would be no charge for the cold item , and of course I was charged for it.  

The guest room and hotel is very dated and worn, the room was nothing special.  I will say the beds were clean and comfortable though.  If you just need a place to sleep by airport this hotel will work but don't expect anything more.
review.negativeRemarks: F&B service, updating of hotel

review.title: Would definitely return and recommend!
review.reviewText: Room was very comfortable and the staff was so nice. I would most certainly stay here again

review.title: Service needs improvement
review.reviewText: In general, comfortable hotel with good facilities. But the people bringing luggage was rude. Arrived at 11pm. No people in the lobby to help us in luggage. We found a trolley by ourselves. When we try to go up, a people (looks like a luggage helper) didn't intend to help us, but said "please bring the trolley down after use". OK, we did as he said. The second day, we called the front desk for a luggage helper, it took 30 minutes for the guy to arrive.
review.positiveRemarks: OK for an overnight stay. Good breakfast. Good for professionals but not family
review.negativeRemarks: Already said.
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.title: Great!!
review.reviewText: My husband and were very pleased. In the beginning I wasn't sure about this hotel. I read several reviews that were positive and maybe 2 that were negative so of course I couldn't really judge it. So I took my chances. When we first drove into the hotel parking lot. It was great!! Hotel, staff it was nice! They have a pool and that was clean and kept up. You didn't have to walk through the lobby with a towel to get to ur room!! It was really nice!! We would stay again and again.

review.title: FIRST TIME HERE
review.reviewText: Walked in, got a smile from Yan, he checked me in, made sure I knew where I could get my water, food etc. Beautiful view from my 11th floor room, clean, and had no issues at all. ONLY down side was the toilet was loud flushing.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, view or airplanes landing, good staff; even gave my daughter a balloon.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: It was nice
review.reviewText: When I walked into the lobby, it was clean and pretty.  It looks like a hotel and I do not feel like I was in some other type of Inns. The people were ready to assist me and I was able to check in with out any addition information except my name. I was then checked in under 2 minutes.  This really help since I was very tire from drive all morning.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpets

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Convenient location near airport with airport transportation.  Pleasant staff.  A/C unit very loud and unsteady and distributive
It was a pleasant stay to a wonderful vacation at Yosemite.
review.locationRemarks: SFO, easy shuttle to the airport

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, great location! The staff could have been a little friendlier & helpful. My family will stay here again.

review.title: Excellent stay!
review.reviewText:
Stayed for 4 nights, excellent service and amenities....no issues at all. The airport shuttle runs every 20 minutes and stays on time. We never got a car...just took the shuttle to the airport and then catch the BART train everywhere. Recommend the $10/day upgraded service to the Executive Lounge, as you can get water, soda, coffee, tea, milk, and yogurt at anytime....and 6-10am continental breakfast, 5-7pm appetizers, and 7-9pm cookies. That is WELL worth it! The hotel restaurant/bar is also fine, as are the flat screen TVs there. Beds are really comfortable! Pool and Jacuzzi were nice to have for relaxing after long days of tourism.

I researched all the options for hotels....the Hilton worked out great! Although near the airport, you do NOT hear any planes, nice views of the bay and planes arriving, though! 

Nothing bad to say about this Hilton....can't even believe some complain about silly stuff.  I'd stay again without any reservations about it.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, close to airport, shuttle, clean, Executive Lounge food/drink/snacks came in very handy
review.negativeRemarks: Less air conditioning in the Executive Lounge, lol....sometimes freezing
review.locationRemarks: Nothing to do nearby, which was fine.   The shuttle to the airport and BART was all that was needed to go somewhere.

review.title: Great location near the airport
review.reviewText: Great location near the airport and convenient travel to and from the airport. Staff was very helpful. Hotel was a bit pricey.

review.title: Don't stay here
review.reviewText:
We arrived at midnight, so we did not expect there to be a line to check in. There were 3 people ahead of us, and as it turns out, the front desk agent took 15-20 minutes to check each person in. It was highly inefficient and frustrating given that we had already arrived so late at night.

The room was very old and didn't look clean. The carpets were grimy and the counters were dusty. The bathroom shower was at the same level as the floor, causing flooding across the bathroom when showering. There was no counter space in the bathroom for any personal toiletries. There was also mold in the bathroom tiles, walls and shower curtain. 

The phone in the room did not work, so we were unable to order room service or call the front desk. The queen sized bed was so short, my feet were hanging over the edge (I am 5 feet 2 inches). 

When checking out in morning, I asked the front desk agent to confirm that my parking ticket was comped. He was very rude and dismissive in his response, leaving me with a bad taste in total.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.

review.title: Super Vacation!
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful and exceeded our expectations.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room was comfortable and the view was stunning .  We enjoyed the breakfast which had a wonderful variety.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport, San Francisco, and restaurants.

review.title: A good place to stay for convenience to SF airport
review.reviewText:
I chose this hotel as the last stop on my vacation in CA in preparation for a flight out of SFO the next morning.
This hotel is clustered with many other major chain hotels a few miles away from SFO.
The hotel offered a free shuttle to SFO every 20 minutes which allowed me to return my rental car a night early.
Other than the convenience to the airport, there's no real reason to stay in this area.
The hotel was fine, with courteous staff. The room was fine.
The restaurant was pricey with slow service.
review.positiveRemarks:
Convenience to SFO
Free shuttle
Nice room, large TV
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant service was slow, pricey.
review.locationRemarks: The location is solely beneficial because of its proximity to SFO.  Otherwise, stay in the city.

review.title: Painful Stay - Do not book this hotel
review.reviewText:
Problems started right from the checkin counter with the respondent who was literraly undertrained, we booked for 3 nights for 2 rooms and he was adament that we only have 2 nights booking for 1 of the room, after 15 mins of scuffle with him we finally got entry for 3 nights.
I booked this hotel because of their complimentary breakfast and beleive me it was the most terrible thing you can get from ur hard earned money.
There was a way too high security for the breakfast room....cameras surrounding u while eating in morning.. LoL
Staff was so rude they were picking stuff while we were picking sides in our plates..
Same menu all 3 days
Parking was paid as well 
Bad hotel architecture..
Everything was so -tive provided the cost we paid for this booking..
Save ur money, book somewhere else, i will never stay in this hotel again

review.title: Tired and old
review.reviewText: This Hilton needs a make-over- top to bottom. Bed was clean, but bathroom had years of hidden dust and dirt. Old tub- showers, Just tired. I probably wouldn't have cared, except it was expensive, so I felt cheated.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything from the carpet up...
review.locationRemarks: Near Airport, didn't have time to explore.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Just in for an overnight stay. Very nice facility with clean room and amenities. Plumbing in bathroom needed some insulation because it was very loud. No bellman to help with luggage which I thought was strange for this type of hotel. But it was ok.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing bathroom plumbing

review.reviewText: The hotel is great and the hotel staff is also great. But the bathtub is little small. And if you want to call taxi from hotel, it is better to do it by yourself because last time I ask the staff who works in Valet Parking to help me find a taxi, he called a private car to me and I think the price is higher than taxi. This is the only thing you should be careful.

review.title: Northern Cal Gal loves this place.
review.reviewText: It is now my home away from home. The location is great and the free shuttle to the Airport very convenient. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was great and the views of San Francisco are spectacular. Clean room and comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Full coffee makers apposed to the pod.
review.locationRemarks: Close to San Francisco and the views of the bay are spectacular.

review.title: Just the basics
review.reviewText: this hotel was clean and comfortable, but it was very basic. No fridge or microwave in rooms and you can tell its older. For the price and location it was a good deal especially the included breakfast which was much better than most.

review.title: Would come back for the pool!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Got a discounted rate from Expedia for $145/night. Retail stated over $300 and i would not say its worth that. The lobby was very nice and updated. Room was a bit dirty, couldnt tell if it was just dusty from no one having stayed in that room for a while or they just did a really quick clean job right before we checked in. Got a lot of use out of the indoor pool. The kids loved it!  The continental breakfast was filling with yummy bacon. Beds were very broken in. Should be replaced soon. Overall good experience and would definitely visit again.

review.title: The worse hotel by far
review.reviewText:
First of all the hotel was very old and dirty and they cover the odor by over spraying febreez which make to the point to make you vomit 
The beds were dirty and bathroom had drainage issue 
Some of the lights were burned, I asked for replacement but no respond 
The beds were small and they make you pay additional fees for everything  
Above all the staff are very rude and valet parking for $26.00 but you have to wait at least 30 minutes to get your car
review.positiveRemarks: none and will never come back
review.negativeRemarks: just read the comments above
review.locationRemarks: everything about 5 miles drive

review.title: Understanding desk clerk and great cher
review.reviewText: Our 5-star rating speaks for itself, but I'd single out the desk clerk who checked us in, waving the parking fee after hearing our tale of minor woe, and our meal in the bar-restaurant, which was the best meal of our entire trip.  Cool server, too.
review.negativeRemarks: The location made it difficult to find if using MapQuest's inaccurate and totally misleading directions. Provide directions. Directions please.
review.locationRemarks: Very conveniently located for air travelers.

review.title: Nice hotel. Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: Room was very nice. Complimentary breakfast had a little to be desired, everything was cold

review.title: Decent hotel for business travel.
review.reviewText: The hotel was up to expectation.  The surrounding seems safe.  The breakfast buffet was very nice and reasonably priced.  the rooms have necessary amenities.  The only downside is lack of central heating/AC.  The in-room unit can be very noisy during the night.

review.title: Clean hotel
review.reviewText: Service is excellent and people are nice .the location is great cause it's the airport

review.title: good airport overnight
review.reviewText: excellent. quiet room ,wall to wall carpet, Quiet close doors.

The staff make us bad impression. Never smile when we checked in. We checked in about 40 minutes. It is so long. I hope the hilton improve their staff. I never met the staff before. I don't know why the staff do that, but he made the customers feel so bad. I won't go there. Don't book this hotel. I hope u can see my experience.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: The hotel provides free shuttle; hot and continental breakfast,  afternoon hot d'oeuvres and fresh fruit for their guests who book the executive rooms. Staff are friendly and helpful.  The mattresses were too soft for my liking but my mother loved it. We had a good time.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Only stayed overnight but was very pleased with all aspects of this lovely hotel.  In particular, the room service was exceptional:  not too pricey; terrific food; and much care given to the presentation and trays.  I have traveled extensively and can honestly say the room service at this hotel far exceeded that of any other hotel I have encountered.
review.negativeRemarks: Minor issue: the plug in the bathtub did not engage so had to take a shower (which was fine).
review.locationRemarks: Adjacent to SFO with excellent free shuttle service.

review.title: Great Stay at a Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I just would like to say, I had a wonderful overnight stay at the Hotel, just wish the a fare I was attending  was a few days longer
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was a little problem, but things still worked out
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.reviewText: Clean rooms, free shuttle service, only issue was the tub in the bathroom had a draining issue. Would stay again if in the area

review.title: Stay experience
review.reviewText: The toilet paper in the bathroom needs to be moved a lot closer to reach it while you are sitting on the toilet. It should be in front of the toilet. I have short arms and I had to stand up in order to get the toilet paper. There should be directions on how to use the A/C unit I did not know the until to turn on is on a complete different way then where the unit actually is at.

review.title: Quick getaway

review.title: Review of Hilton Bayfront, San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our California trip ended with a five day stay at the Hilton Bayfront in San Fran.  The room was comfortable with a great view of the Bay. The room had been selectively upgraded except for the shower/tub. We paid additional for access to the Executive Lounge. The Lounge access included breakfast and a pre-dinner snack and free coffee, soda and water all day until 9pm. The Hilton serves Starbucks coffee and per cup you pay about 4.00 dollars a cup so I recommend for travelers staying more than a day to pay the extra and get access to the lounge. The hotel charges 14.00 dollars a day for parking which is unnecessary since they have a garage beneath the hotel. If you book at this hotel, get a deal that includes executive lounge and free parking.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was comfortable and quiet a night.

The controls to the shower were broken and the bathroom floor had black stains all over.  I booked this room so my children would have access to a pool and myself a hot tub for the evening.  The pool area was clean, though the pool very small.   The hot tub was very dirty.  The water was a strange color, smelled bad, there were little bugs in it  and it was cold.   I was very surprised that a Hilton hotel would be so poorly maintained.

review.title: Awesome Experience with No Driving Needed.
review.reviewText:
After a 30-Day driving road trip last year we decided to try a "No-Driving" trip for this Christmas in San Francisco. We flew into SF International and free-shuttled to the hotel. 

Hilton accommodations were excellent with a superb room and wonderful staff. When we went into the city we would catch the hotel shuttle back to the airport where we hopped on the BART and into the city...Union Square...etc. and then the Trolley Cars. We were able to go everywhere with no driving and no parking fees. We Stayed for only 3 days in the bay area and then head south to the beaches. On our 10 day trip we actually did no driving and no car rentals at all. 

We would highly recommend the Airport Hilton. Our home is in Houston TX but one of our favorite places is the bay area and Marin County. We will definitely undertake some future weekend "getaways" using this stress-free travel formula....ENJOY!

I will go back to this hotel next visit as I think the rate is reasonable and location is convenient.

review.reviewText: I was disappointed that the hotel is charging parking fees. The parking fee should be free and complimentary to the guests that are checked-in to the hotel. I will try other hotels next time I'm in the area. Rooms are just ok. Nothing is really special. I noticed that there are some portion of the wallpaper in the bathroom that are starting to peel off at the edges. The tiles in bathroom floor needs major mopping. The maid that came in the morning to clean just vacuum the flooring and change the towels. I stayed in the room the whole time while the cleaning lady was there. And I'm glad I did. The linens were not changed at all. I guess I have to request for it. She just folded and straighten the covers and I had to reuse the ones I used the night before. I wonder if they change it between guest that comes in/out since cleaning ladies don't have a single idea of the guests schedule. This is a turn-off for this kind of hotel. I was expecting more for a five-star than I witnessed.

review.title: Close to airport, nice end to vacation.
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was wonderful!  Very helpful with directions to car rental return at airport and gas station on the way.  Christina even printed off maps so I couldn't get lost.  :)  

The room was very nice, the bathroom could us a little updating.  But overall very nice.  Just a suggestion, cleaning staff with long hair should wear hair tied back, nothing worse than long dark hairs on bathroom floor and walls of shower.  I had a few in my bathroom, daughters was bad enough that she called housekeeping to come and reclean her bathroom.  The young woman that came up was very sweet about it.  

Shuttle to airport was great.  Turned in car night before and didn't have to worry about it at 5 am.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great, nice staff and overall nice rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom could be updated just a little.
review.locationRemarks: Location is near airport and it was the end of our vacation and we just stayed overnight to catch an early flight.

review.title: Hard to find, nothing around, nobody in bar...
review.reviewText: really thin walls and screaming  children did not make for a pleasant stay. the place reminded me of a cheap La Quinta, but worse, as those have fridges. for the price, this place blows, but the staff are very friendly

review.title: Technically a "bay view" room...
review.reviewText:
The room we booked was labeled "bay view," this was the reason we chose this hotel instead of others, because there was no surcharge for a view of the bay. However, while I could technically see a sliver of the bay, the majority of our view was highway and the other part of the hotel building.  Disappointing, but at least we didn't pay extra for the view.

Also the room has a somewhat musty smell, fixed by opening the window, but could have been better.

review.title: It was ok. Beautiful surroundings
review.reviewText: It was ok. Stayed there for the whole week. Surge front desk staff was friendly. The restaurant staff is typical union hotel staff. Slow and unresponsive. Except for one female bartender at night. She was great. Did not have hot water on the last day. Had to take cold shower.
Very enjoyable stay. Staff was friendly and helpful and the room perfect.

review.title: Room hotel
review.reviewText:
Air condition is loud so I kept waking up.

People at the reception are very nice. 
Parking is great although had a hard time getting in and out using the room key

review.title: Nice hotel by the Bay
review.reviewText: Like the location , very nice nature walk around the bay.
Everythings Fine, Gott also parking for free! Also Good for Sightseeing, just 20min from downtown

review.title: Great airport hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was bright, cheery, clean, and comfortable.

review.title: Great hotel close to airport but not at all noisy.

review.reviewText: When they added a thermostat to the room they left the outside wall unit on high with no opportunity to turn down the fan.  This made for a very noisy night.

review.title: Nice location.
review.reviewText: Room was not clean, we had a water leak from the room above. They relocated us late at night but was not very helpful in compensating for the incovienence.

review.title: No complimentary breakfast for the steep price.
review.reviewText: Close to airport, but that's about it. Pricey w/o room fridge or comp breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport and free shuttle
review.negativeRemarks: Fridge in room and comp breakfast
review.locationRemarks: take shuttle to airport in short time

review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and helpful.  The room was comfortable and clean.  The shuttle service to the airport was reliable.  I don't travel much so I don't have much to compare it to, but my stay there was a very pleasant experience overall.

review.title: Bring your own food
review.reviewText: This hotel,location, staff are great. However, the breakfast buffet is not worth $20 bucks! No champagne, no carving station, no omlet bar...nothing that makes it worth the money. When I complained to guest service I was told that they serve bacon! FYI-they serve bacon @ McDonalds and it's not $20!! I could have ordered steak &eggs from room service for the same price. Other than that I loved the hotel and it is situated on the bay and offers a nice pathway for a pleasant morning walk. I would recommend this location to anyone,,,just not the buffet breakfast!

review.title: One night before leaving San Francisco Bay area
review.reviewText: Nice, convenient close to the airport. Sauna and pool could be bigger though

review.title: Good Airport stopover
review.reviewText:
Close to airport, short ride in Shuttle. Nice to have a walk around the bay front.

Great airport stopover, good pleasant staff, That's San Francisco, always nice to visit.
review.negativeRemarks: Its a little older but wasn't expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport, Nice Bay walk!!

review.title: Good value hotel
review.reviewText: It was great. Good service. Good food. The air con in the room was noisy.  I would still go there again. Great value for the price.

review.title: excellent willgo back
review.reviewText: superved located near malls and excellent restaurants. Environment is safe.People are helful.
review.locationRemarks: excellent restaurantsand shopping malls

review.title: Short but pleasant
review.reviewText: Small hotel but convenient location. Really just had to stay for sleeping. Did not need anything more.

Surprised there was not  even a coffee pot in the lobby to encourage visitors to linger and visit.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with a view of the bay.
review.reviewText: My wife and I had booked the hotel for the bay area with our friends coming up from San Diego and wanted to stay closer to the wharf in town, too expensive.  A little reluctantly booked with the Bayfront.  Wow, what a beautiful hotel.  The entire staff was friendly!  Room was immaculate, comfortable, new and just superb.  15th floor Executive dining was incredible.  Staff just perfect, friendly, smiling and accomodating.  Particular mention, Charina in that lounge is a perfect example of the staff of this hotel.  Food was excellent.  The short walk to the bayfront walkway was beautiful.   When we return to San Fran, that is my choice.  So so glad we did not stay in town.  Thank you so much for a fantastic accomodation for our recent trip!
review.positiveRemarks: Newness, staff, food, clean, roomy accomodations.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Fairly easy access to down town, wharf and San Jose, all.  In the middle.

review.title: Decent not exceptional
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine for a night's stay.  Mostly clean room and comfortable bed.  Very nice shuttle van from airport to hotel--about a 15 minute ride.   Room service was average.

review.title: Meh

review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness

review.reviewText: We had a great stay on our way back from wine country before we flew out.  The hotel was beautiful and staff was terrific. We would definitely go back for another stay.

review.positiveRemarks: The hotel shuttle to the airport was convenient.

Top tip - ask for a room at the bottom of the corridor

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: I couldn't have asked for a nicer stay at such a lovely hotel. Checking is was easy and the hotel staff was friendly. We forgot toothbrushes and they quickly sent complimentary ones to our room. The room was very comfortable. In fact, the bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept on in a hotel. There was a big flat screen tv and plenty of room throughout the room for us to feel relaxed and not crowded. We were even given a room with a view, which was quite lovely. A big "thank you" to the staff for a job well done! Clean, friendly, comfortable....what else could  you ask for?
review.positiveRemarks: Everything! But, especially the comfort of the bed. We had a restful sleep.

2) the hotel parking fee was charge twice in my invoice. After I asked, they corrected it.
3) the breakfast buffet price is different from the room service manual. It is cost $17 instead of $11 in the book.

review.title: Nice hotel, service lacking in some places
review.reviewText: Stayed with family for two nights, the room was pretty neat and well kept. Nice views on the bay and bathroom was clean. Biggest down sides were the lack of any scale whatsoever to weigh luggage and the terrible restaurant staff. Waited 20+ minutes after being seated and no waitress ever came despite being told twice that she was on her way and the restaurant had all of 2 other customers inside. In the end my order was taken by the front desk staff and food was mediocre at best. Overall give it 3.5

review.title: Quite disappointing
review.reviewText:
The room decor and condition is quite dated, and the bed is not comfortable either. The location is good if you need to catch a flight, but the noise from landing and take-off is inevitable. The only modern touch is the dining room and bar, but unfortunately guests who booked via Expedia are excluded from the opportunity to enjoy the breakfast. 

The key is a torture, you need to swipe dozen times to get into your room and garage. There is no elevator from garage to the hotel directly, you have to walk into the hotel to get another elevator to get to your room, which is really inconvenient.
review.locationRemarks: To catch the early flight.

review.title: Great "Bay View"

review.positiveRemarks: Big clean room and great view from the 11th floor overlooking the bay. Great plane spotting as you are right on the SF Airport approach pattern.
review.locationRemarks: This is a great place to base your SF weekend getaway if you would like to be near the airport. Very easy access to Hwy 101 and just 35 minutes to SF.

Brief ride from SFO and check in was fast, up in my room to a VERY comfortable bed in short order, and had a long sleep. Breakfast was included and was very good with excellent coffee. Highly recommend.

review.title: nice and clean room

review.title: Not as great as I hoped
review.reviewText: While I found the staff very courteous and responsive, I was disappointed to find the swimming pool closed for repairs, the ice machine broken on my floor, and the temperature control in the room limited so it got a bit warm. When I checked out, I was asked if I enjoyed my stay and I was rather lack-luster in my response and told them about the ice machine issue and the clerk took $15 off my bill - this was appreciated. The key card also didn't let me get my car out of the special garage, so I had to reach out for the extra button to intercom the front desk to leave. Lastly, I felt paying for parking on top of the room cost was a unfortunate side effect of going through the mystery hotel purchase procedures.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were all pleasant and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Having some option to cancel when I was specifically looking forward to a swim/hot tub and this was a disappointment to learn the facility was closed.

review.title: close to the airport
review.reviewText: when we arrived the front desk guy asked if we'd like to upgrade to a suite facing the bay - given that it was 9 at night and we had a 5am flight I told him that and he said 'fine, no excuses..' He then asked us if we want to join their loyalty program and when I declined he was huffy about it - just tossed me the keys and said no more. Wow. Given we booked a week early and paid in advance letting them know we had two adults and two teenage kids with us I would have expected 4 shower towels - nope, only three. How about glasses or cups for water and/or coffee? only two. Having paid a lot for the one night with such advanced notice I expected more. And our room was right next to another guest (I'm sure for housekeeping efficiency since there was hardly a soul in the hotel that weeknight) who kept their tv on *all night* Never will I stay with Hilton SF Airport again. There are too many better options.

I ordered in a late dinner with a caesars salad and spicy chicken wings and though nothing really special, was still appetizing and service was again very good.

They didn't have a king bed when I checked in and the person helping me offered me access to their executive services which was very nice (didn't even have to ask).

Rooms were clean and comfortable with a view of the bay, flat screen tv, plugins for internet (as well as wireless, which I got free for being an HHonors member) and I think even allowed you to plug in a laptop to view on tv, which I didn't try, but was a nice little addition.

review.title: Good for Hotel, But Good for Hilton?
review.reviewText:
We recently stayed with some family friends for a weekend in San Francisco. We checked in very late (3:00 A.M.) as we had already given the heads up we would be doing. Upon check in it was difficult to find our second room because it came through as two separate reservations one under my last name and one under my last name with a 1.

The wi-fi worked well and we got it free which is always a plus. Wasn't sure if it was supposed to be free but it was. Upon returning the first night, our entire floor smelled strongly of Marijuana. With a 1,2,3 year old between our two rooms we told the staff we could simply not bare the smell as it was now creeping into our rooms once we had opened the door. We were immediately sent to a different floor and a member of the staff came to our door within minutes with the new keys. We were also given access to free breakfast in the lounge (though this is something I'd love to see Hilton's simply offer for their price, along with free wi-fi at all locations). The staff the first night was not personable, the staff the second night was great. Checkout was again not a very personable experience.

All in all the hotel is nice, not amazing for a Hilton property. The price we got was nearly $40 cheaper on Expedia than when we had looked on the hotel site. We could stay here again in the future for the right price, but other hotels in the immediate area have been higher on our experience list in past years.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff meeting needs which were out of their control. Room size is decent

review.title: unfaire wifi charge & noise from plane taking off
review.reviewText:
Hotel charges wifi fee per each device used, and claimed it was by state law. This was not clearly mentioned in anywhere else, during check in or wifi registration. After raised the question about the charge during check out, hotel said they gave a discount and charged 2 devices per day. Since we are in hurry to leave, there was no time to discuss this with them. Three days later, we called the manager about this issue. He said the charge was based on its property. We told him Helton in LA does not have such charge, neither does Marietta nor others. If they have such charge, they shall clearly state if before we booking. He said he dropped the extra charge for us.
This was very bad experience, especially you were charged for something you never knew, and not in any other places, within or outside Helton.

Neil at the front desk was so helpful and friendly. The room was nice--nothing spectacular, but definitely better than some other "4 star" hotels we've stayed at recently. Our one complaint would be about the condition of the heated indoor pool. The pool is in dire need of renovation. The temperature was really cold and our daughter couldn't stop shivering. It was also dirty the first time we went. (We complained and the staff was quick to respond.) Otherwise, we were very happy with our stay and would recommend this hotel to other families.

review.title: Disappointed by the sexist attitude of the staff
review.reviewText:
Very disappointed by the sexist attitude of both members of reception staff we encountered. The room was booked under my name, which is different to my husband's. When we arrived and they requested a credit card for incidentals, it was my card that was handed over. The man, however, proceeded to speak only to my husband and did not so much as make eye contact with me, which would have been extremely rude even if it hadn't been booked under my name. The same was true when we checked out - the woman on reception spoke only to my husband. I've never encountered this at any other hotel. I'm disgusted.
Rooms are clean and comfortable, and the swimming pool and Jacuzzi, although small, were very welcome when we wanted to exercise before a long day's flying. Breakfast is very expensive - try and ensure you don't need to eat until you get to the airport. We ordered the eggs benedict and split it between us.
Free transfer to the Hilton from the airport is quick from airport to hotel, but takes a little longer on the way back to the airport as it stops at a couple of other places - be sure to factor this into your return travel plan.
Staff and rip-off breakfast aside, it's actually pretty comfortable with a decent view.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff should be trained to realize that women book hotel rooms too, and therefore it's rude to only address their husbands.
review.locationRemarks: The pond outside the hotel with its walking/running track was pretty and made for a pleasant morning walk.

review.title: Lovely stay at the Hilton Bayfront
review.reviewText: No question this is a superbly-managed hotel, all of the above ratings absolutely a 5, Excellent.. Big, clean, attractive room and bathroom; big TV and a lot of selections to purchase or some free TV; no mini-fridge or microwave (did have a one- or two-cup coffeemaker, iron & board, blow dryer). Has a good dining room and cultural menu (I can't eat enough for the $16.95 breakfast buffet; opted for really good Eggs Benedict instead, I think $12). $18/day for parking ($25/day for valet parking. Notices to guests encourage conservation and all staff I encountered were friendly and helpful. I needed to visit the northwestern corner of San Francisco, so the daily drive was a bit long and a little complicated for a newcomer to West Coast driving, but doable; note, however, that it was the city's "summer" and there was little fog. Not too far north is a shopping center, after a bit of finding it, in case you need it. Fast, easy check-in (even 4 hours early!); easy check-out.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking costs could be less or gone, especially for the outside parking.
review.locationRemarks: Tanforan Park Shopping Center around San Bruno. The location is south of the airport, so the area has many large, well-known good chain hotels.
