review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel with a great price, thanks to Expedia!

review.title: Out of the way but completely worth it!
review.reviewText: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. The location is a little out of the way but I like that because the hotel is easily accessible. Check in is fast and staff is very helpful and friendly. The room is comfortable. However, if you want a view of the bay, make sure to ask. The two times I have stayed at this hotel, my window faces the side of a building and I had to look to my left and press my face against the window for a view. I did not eat in the hotel restaurant because last time the menu didn't have much to offer. However, after a long day, I ordered room service and the food is absolutely delicious! Not too many restaurant options in the area of the hotel so I would recommend deciding where to eat before booking or eating at the hotel itself. The hotel is very clean and modern. Overall, enjoyed my stay very much.
review.locationRemarks: The location is remote so you pretty much have to drive anywhere you want to go in order to really do anything.

review.title: Friendly staff, well-run hotel
review.reviewText:
Exactly what I expect from a well-run Hilton hotel. No surprises, just comfortable rooms, professional staff, fast check-in. The lounge has an excellent view of the bay toward the south.

I messed up my check-in date, but the front desk staff quickly found me a room. Bellhop was equally helpful.

The only disappointment was the shuttle driver. One passenger missed the Delta terminal and had to walk back from United. In my case, the driver failed to inform me that the United terminal had a premium check-in section. This would have made my check-in less stressful...
review.positiveRemarks: Front desk staff, comfy and quiet rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Get a shuttle driver who is customer-focused

managementResponses.response:
I am terribly sorry we were not able to provide you with the room you requested. It is very unusual and I thank you for your understanding.

Regards,
John C. Kellites / General Manager

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: While they didn't have the king bed I booked. I was given a free breakfast buffet that more than made up for it.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the SFO international airport
review.reviewText: The check-in process was efficient, And the room was nice and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: TV remote control was broken. Both the maid and the maintenance engineer came within 10-15 minutes to fix the problem.
review.negativeRemarks: There was some stain on the sofa chair. House cleaning staff was notified.

review.title: easy and close to sfo
review.reviewText: good airport hotel for short stay. Free shuttle to sfo/hotel, every 20 minutes. Great staff. Right next to water and walking trails. Also has gym/pool I didn't use. Breakfast buffet or order off menu.
review.locationRemarks: walking trail on bay

review.title: Good location with excellent services
review.reviewText:
All good except the service from the Restaurant which did not seem able to cope with the numbers staying over a long weekend when we visited, however, the bar manager was most accomodating and assisted us and others with an evening meal.
the concierge and counter staff were also most helpful as was the bus attendants to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant service.
review.locationRemarks: we were visiting San francisco to catch up with some tours and sight seeing as well as an extended visit to Yosemite.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed the stay. Wish the parking was included as well. They didn't validate the parking for the overnight stay.

The hotel staff was very nice in returning some items that I left in my room.

review.title: It is above average .
review.reviewText: for $ 119 night, it is fairly descent and won't mind staying here again for a quick stay . though the gym was just to small and the $18 parking overnight sucked .
review.negativeRemarks: better parking rate and upgrade the buffet and fitness center

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice and it is in a nice location only thing is it's really close to the airport which is convenient but you can hear the planes all day and night. Also, the pool is tiny and smells like there is too much chlorine and the "spa" is a small hot tub.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are big and nice, the bed is very comfortable

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. View of the bay was nice and the staff was accomodating. Would recommend to anyone
review.locationRemarks: Kincaid restaurant is a very good choice and walking distance from the hotel. The park/trail is walking distance as well.

review.title: Only stayed one night but enjoyed it.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the beautiful view of the bay, the walking path, and nearby restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to SFO, easy on/off to expressway, friendly, helpful staff.

review.title: 3 night leisure stay
review.reviewText: Nice bike path adjacent to property. Clean, well designed rooms. Most important of all we had a nice, quiet, comfortable sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Upon check-in clearly explain to guests how to exit parking lot. Our first night we had to pay $3 to open the gate.
review.locationRemarks: Bike path; close to freeway.

review.title: Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: My son and I planned a trip to San Francisco and stayed here for 4 days. It was a nice hotel. Food was expensive in their restaurant but was good. The swimming pool was small and the spa was broken. The rooms were really nice and the beds were comfy!
review.positiveRemarks: The service was great! The bellmen and the front desk staff were really accommodating and helpful!
review.negativeRemarks: There's not much that they can do to improve, other than having the spa working. They aren't close to places to eat.
review.locationRemarks: This is easy to get to off the 101! We went into San Francisco every day and also to the beach and it was easy to get around.

review.title: SFO Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: Dining in the hotel restaurant was enjoyable. Food was tasty & bay view was beautiful.

review.title: Very nice experience.
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel as a last minute gateway during the Labor Day weekend. My flight arrived at 10:00 am, therefore I arrived to the hotel several hours before check in. However, upon arrival to the concierge desk the front desk staff were very friendly and offered me an available room. Luckily, i did't have to wait until 3:00 pm. I was very pleased with everyone that I came in contact with, including the shuttle driver. I totally recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The appearance, cleaniness, location, friendly staff members, and room comfort. I enjoyed the bayfront view from my room.
review.negativeRemarks: The service at the bar was very slow (on Friday night) and the bartender appeared overwhelmed with the large amount of patrons.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located minutes away from the airport, which it's perfect. I used the Bart system to get around town.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Ok the building is old the room could be more yUpdated
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanses
review.locationRemarks: Nice

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for sharing your stay experience with us. Your time is extremely valuable and we are very grateful for your valuable feedback. My staff is always excited to read the comments our guests.

Regards,
John C. Kellites / General Manager

review.title: Great Time
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel. We even ordered room service which was delicious. The rooms were nice, the view beautiful. The only thing I didn't like was that you had to pay for internet service and the hot tub is more like a bathtub, really small.
review.negativeRemarks: really needs a larger hot tub

review.title: Nice hotel close to sfo
review.reviewText: This hotel is nice. Shuttle service to sfo was outstanding. The staff were professional and curtious. I'd stay here again.

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, we arrived early in the afternoon and were given a room right away. Good location if you are renting a car, parking charges are ok.

review.title: Hotel on the San Fran Bay
review.reviewText: Stayed for 7 nites touring San Francisco and surrounding area. Comfortable beds and very clean. Views of the bay were beautiful.
review.positiveRemarks: beds were very comfortable. The cleaning staff was very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: They need mini refrigerators in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for San Francisco tourists

review.title: Friendly staff and very clean room.
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and the room was very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: No parking fees for hotel guest.

review.title: Nice hotel near the SFO airport
review.reviewText: The room seems newly updated, appears very nice. The beds are comfortable, and the bathroom is very clean. I did not hear any noise from the airport.

review.title: Fine hotel, room was nice, staff was courteous.
review.reviewText: Had an early morning flight out of SFO and the shuttle was prompt and efficient getting me to the airport on time.

review.title: Nice hotel near the beach with view.
review.reviewText:
Hotel staff and accommodations were pleasing. Shuttle service to the airport was on time! Wake up call was on time for early flight.

Dinner at the hotel restaurant was average and over priced for the meal we received. Service was good. Ordered the evening special, Red Snapper, it was reminded me of a TV dinner, but not quite as good. I would not recommend!

review.title: Nice view of the bay
review.reviewText:
We stayed there for one night as we had a flight to catch the next day. The stay was pleasant and the hotel staff were friendly. They also let us check in earlier than the scheduled time. The location is 10 minutes drive away from the airport.
The continental breakfast was somewhat limited in variety but served the purpose well. The room was simple compared to other Hilton properties I have stayed at, but I guess it was because it was a airport hotel. A shuttle is also provided which has a frequency of 20 minutes.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at your lovely hotel, but it would have been nice if there was a small refrigerator in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Polite staff, well kept rooms, and a nice bar area.
review.negativeRemarks: Put small refrigerators in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport and a short ride to the city.

review.title: pleasing
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very nice.
my only complaint was a foul odor just at the front of our door. i think it was pet urine,
everything else was fine,
review.positiveRemarks: Everything was nice, the hotel, rooms. spa and pool and the restaurant. the staff was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: maintaining air freshness at arrival of our room
review.locationRemarks: We had an awesome bayfront view

review.title: Nice hotel. Room service shoddy.
review.reviewText: The hotel was nicely-appointed, very clean and convenient to the airport, which is why we elected to stay there. Upon arrival, the staff were friendly, helpful and attentive. The free airport shuttle was definitely a plus as well! The only negative, and I felt it was a big one, was our room service experience. We were pretty tired and hungry, and had to get an early start the next morning, so we chose to dine in our room. I ordered a turkey sandwich and fries. My wife ordered eggs, bacon and rye toast. It took about 40 minutes to get the food. When it came, the person delivering it took the lids off, waited just long enough to get his tip, and disappeared with the food covers. The food was barely warm and my wife's toast was missing. I tried to catch the server, but no luck. I immediately called room service and explained. They were apologetic and said they would fix it right away. Finally, after another half hour elapsed, I called back and told them to forget it. No microwave in the room, so we ate a basically unappetizing meal. My turkey sandwich was fine. Anyway, fix this problem and you have a great hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: Room food service and microwaves in rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Great if you need access to airport. Nothing to do around hotel. Nice view of bay!

review.title: Had a great stay!
review.reviewText: The four of us stayed here for one night and were very happy the service. The airport shuttle was very convenient and the staff allowed a very early check in at 6 am. So we got a good rest before starting our day. Breakfast was great too. No complaints.

review.title: Convenient location close to airport with shuttle
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with beautiful room. Disappointed that wi-fi is not included.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Internet

review.title: Family Getaway
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice is not a bit overpriced for a basic room with no frills. Could really use a fridge and microwave. The air conditioner was a vital part of the room as it got stuffy, but it was so loud nobody slept very well during our stay. The TV was a great size, but movies were very pricey.
review.positiveRemarks: Was nice an clean and people were friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Fridge and microwave in room

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: The only negative thing was that we arrived pretty late (around 10:30pm) and they told us that our room wasn't ready. they offered to give us food vouchers and go to restaurant but we were with tired kids who just wanted to go to bed. They found us a room and still gave us 2 breakfast vouchers. The shuttle was also pretty nice and comfortable.

review.title: Good Airport stop over hotel .
review.reviewText:
We used the Hilton hotel as a stop over between flights from Hawaii and Uk . Excellent free shuttle service from and to SFO . We also used the free trolley bus service from the Hotel to the suburb of Burlinghame, a quiet small town with plenty of restaurants and boutique shops. The hotel pool was fine. We booked an executive room which entitled us to use the executive lounge for complimentary drinks( hot and soft beverages ) also breakfast and appetisers early evening whilst enjoying stunning views of the bay and airport in a relaxing atmosphere.
We used room service as we arrived late and found the food good prompt with good presentation. Overall a good hotel for airport stopover , lovely walk from hotel along the bay .
Excellent door man was really helpful and went out of his way to get us info, he was a credit to the hotel also lovely staff in executive lounge .
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms a little tired and not up to UK Hilton standard.
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO and great location by the bay overlooking the city and airport.

review.title: Great stay for couples
review.reviewText: excellent place to stay and enjoyed the free shuttle services for the airport . All in all a recommended place.

review.title: Convenient for SFO airport
review.reviewText: We just stayed overnight before flying out of SFO. It was pleasant and convenient. Nice bar for a drink.

review.title: Good price and convenient to airport
review.reviewText: Our flight to Kona was cancelled and delayed for 2 days. We found a room at the Hilton far cheaper than other hotels in the immediate area.
review.positiveRemarks: The walking path around the pond and along the shore was nice. And the convenient location to the airport was helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The pool needs repairs and renovations.

review.title: nice stay for the money
review.reviewText: We just came back from a weekend stay and we were happy that we stayed in Hilton's.The hotel is closed enough to the airport but we could not hear the planes.Room was spacious,staff was friendly and the bathroom was clean.It was a nice stay and the price was affordable than a downtown hotel.

review.title: Old and musty. Pictures are enhanced on website
review.reviewText:
You are first greeted by the name of the hotel projected on to a wall which is a sign of lack of spending
When we walked in there was a water spill and a fair amount and the cleaning lady was using bedroom towels to dry up the mess with her feet
The room was okay but sheets smelled and the hallways also have a musty odor
Only handy feature is free shuttle to and from airport
The bath tub was old and dated and stained
If you aren't picky and want a a cheap night near hotel them great
The surrounding bay is nice
review.negativeRemarks: Smelly sheets

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel in a wonderful location that served tasty food at a reasonable price. I appreciated comfortable beds and the entire room
review.locationRemarks: On the bay. Very pleasant walking.

review.title: It was clean and very comforting to stay there
review.reviewText: I am def. coming back it was a great experience for me and my gf.

review.title: Great Place!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed staying at the Hilton SanFrancisco Airport hotel! It made the ease of going returning to the airport very seamless, especially since we had a very early flight. The only downside was that there were not a lot of eating options for people traveling with children, but otherwise the rooms were very comfortable, and well appointed.
review.positiveRemarks: We really liked the rooms! They had very comfortable beds and plenty of pillows / blankets for our stay. The room wa well decorated!
review.locationRemarks: The location was beautiful with walking trails around the water. Only downside was there was not a lot of eateries, etc. around the hote.

review.title: Standard Hilton
review.reviewText: Standard Hilton. Pay for everything including Wifi unless you ask politely or are an HHonors member.

review.title: Hotel is nice has friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Restaurant inside the hotel overall it was a pleasant stay, thank you
review.negativeRemarks: Pool with less chlorin in it.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco

review.title: 1 night before flight
review.reviewText: Good room service, quiet, clean and comfortable. Room service was very, very good
review.positiveRemarks: convienant, clean and comfortable. Good pillows and bedding
review.negativeRemarks: Disney channel for the kids
review.locationRemarks: nothing within walking distance

review.title: Great Stay!!
review.reviewText: I really appreciated the great shuttle to and from the airport as well as the trolley that took me to Burlingame and the Caltrain. The staff were friendly and they were helpful. I would highly recommend the Hilton SFO.
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttles, friendly staff and they helped me make a copy and get my boarding pass.
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful walking trail by the water!!!

review.title: Overall nice hotel, but parking fee ridiculous...
review.reviewText: We stayed there with our two kids after a long Yosemite journey and long lines around San Francisco, this was fairly easy access to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel is far from San Francisco proper, yet they find the need to charge $18 for overnight parking. There is plenty of land and parking.

review.title: Ideal for sightseeing in SF
review.reviewText: We stayed three nights with a four people family and did daily tours in SF. Everything was perfect! High standard comparable to Switzerland.

review.title: Great access to airport
review.reviewText: We had four rooms for people ages 77 - 25. Everyone enjoyed their room. Great for traveling out if airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Near airport. View of bay was lovely. Staff very friendly and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Not much within walking distance. Perfect for our needs as we had been driving all week and wanted a place to rest for few days before returning home

review.title: The hotel is well located. Very nice hotel by airp
review.reviewText: My stay was a business trip. Very nice desk and work space
review.negativeRemarks: Printers in Business center
review.locationRemarks: Very Close to alot resturants

review.title: Floor access
review.reviewText:
I stayed with my friend family in this hotel in 2 seperate room.
I understand that they might not be able to gave me us same floor room as we checked in very late night.
So they gave me a room in 10th floor, and 15th floor to my friend.
And we had a things to issue to share after checked in.
So I need to go to my friend's room in 15th floor, however, I can't access.
That makes me really scared as I thougth that Elevator is broken.
I need to travel to first floor to see security to report elevator broken, then he advised me that I need to key authorization to acess 15th floor. All processing take at least 20minutes which is really valuable time for me.

No one advised us that only authorized persone can acces 15th floor.
Even my friends stays in 15th, she didn't know that she need a key to access 15th floor.

Which is very careless servise.
review.positiveRemarks: easy acess to SFO and downtown.
review.negativeRemarks: advise customer ahead that certain floor need to access authorization.

review.title: Great quality and value
review.reviewText: Great, very comfortable, and efficient. Highly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: No free internet

review.title: Big Name Hotel fails in expectation......
review.reviewText: The Hilton name carries big weight. However, this hotel does not live up to expectations. Charging guests an additional fee for parking and internet service is ridiculous!! The "Hilton" did not offer anything complimentary. Our room was standard, nothing fancy. When we turned the shower on, it sprayed up to the ceiling every time and the toilet water would run off and on. I don't know, maybe people have gotten used to settling for less. I wonder if the "Hilton" family would have appreciated staying here??

review.title: Good stop near airport on a CA wedding trip
review.reviewText: The room was very nice, clean, spacious. We didn't eat at the restaurant but it looked nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The room had an unusually long counter that was convenient for laying out our "stuff". Terrific bed, work desk, and overall plenty of room for two.

review.title: Friendly staff- happy with room
review.reviewText:
We were only staying one night. Room was comfortable, hotel made effort to have nice rooms. Could tell hotel is dated but recent renovations were nice. Clean and comfortable. Staff was very helpful- one man ran around the counter to give my 4 year old a balloon that matched her outfit.
Beds were comfortable. Shower was clean too!
I would stay again!
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport

review.title: Hilton airport
review.reviewText:
It is easy to miss the exit for the hotel from Hwy 101. The road has many turns and is very dark. The elevator from the parking level to the lobby did not work on arrival. The automatic wakeup call did not work. Our card access to
parking garage did not work and they tried reprograming our card every night. A lot of little aggravating issues.
The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. Very hard to get around without a car. I would only recommend a stay here if your activities were close by.

review.title: Nice comfy stay
review.reviewText:
Overall very good . Parking at night could not find space. Had to come out of garage
And give to valet

review.title: Close to City pretty view
review.reviewText: Love it! Close to the city! Beautiful view. Rooms were clean, check in and check out was fast. Food was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: The pool
review.locationRemarks: The city

review.title: Mediocre visit
review.reviewText: Tv remote did not work, bathroom counters stainedm phone buttons did not work, Room 433. Have stayed several times, not sure I will again.

review.title: Great location just outside the city
review.reviewText: Close to the airport so thats super convenient if you have a late arrival, or early departure from SFO. its just 20 minutes outside downtown SF, and only 30 minutes from Mountain View. This helps cut down on any travel time if you have multiple destinations in the Bay Area. Friendly staff, clean and attractive rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: the TV and desk/workstation was very useful as I was on business and able to get free internet and a comfortable spot to work.
review.negativeRemarks: the bathroom (specifically the shower/tub) looks a little dated.

review.title: This is a very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Had very good breakfast & rooms very nice. The hotel is hard to see but worth finding

review.title: The hotel staff were rude.
review.reviewText: They were not accomodating to my pet even though they said they were a pet friendly hotel. The room service food was burnt.

review.title: Great hotel, alternative to Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: The stay was pleasant and the access to freeway is very easy. Good hotel to stay as visitors to San Francisco if you have a car. San Francisco is less than 15 miles away and the room rate is reasonable.
review.positiveRemarks: The room rate and the qulity.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel should inform the travelers that it is one of the AT&T WiFi hotspots. Otherwise, the hotel will charge $10 per day for the access.

review.title: A decent hotel without spending a fortune
review.reviewText: The old adage applies here: you get what you pay for. This hotel is perhaps a half-step above a Holiday Inn. Of the name hotels near SFO, this one must be the least expensive. If you're looking for luxury, this is probably not the right place.
review.positiveRemarks: Two important things were absolutely right: the bedding is very good, and the thermostat & HVAC unit worked exactly as they should.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom fixtures seemed a bit out of date, tub was cracked.
review.locationRemarks: This is a good location if being near SFO is important to you. It gives you a good launch point for Palo Alto, Fremont, Cupertino as well as San Fran.

review.title: Semi-secluded picturesque location
review.reviewText: We were delighted with the beauty of the lobby, dining rooms and individual room! Everything was immaculately clean, comfortable and fresh-smelling. Breakfast buffet was a big convenience. Staff were all super-friendly and made us feel special. Loved the location near a wooded area right on the Bay.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the spaciousness, cleanliness and decor of the hotel and our room. Staff were amazing. Breakfast buffet was a big plus.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe the fan in the bathroom checked...ours never went on, but we didn't even think of reporting it!
review.locationRemarks: Right near the airport, easily accessible by rental car. There was a nature trail to walk on the perimeter of the Bay.

review.title: convenient and pleasant
review.reviewText: Desk staff were pleasant and courteous, checking in and out were effortless. The staff in the "Windows" restaurant were also of the same caliber and the meals were quite good. A little outside of the core area of San Francisco but easy enough to get to and from.

review.title: A fantastic break from a hectic vacation schedule.
review.reviewText: My flight back from Europe had unfortunately been rescheduled so that I was forced to spend a night in the S.F. area awaiting my continuing flight to my final destination of Austin. It was great to have such a nice room to stay in. It had all of the amenities I was hoping for and really enjoyed my stay there. It's only minutes from the airport with a complimentary shuttle so that really helped with my trip.
review.positiveRemarks: The room, the breakfast and the convenient shuttle to the airport.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the bay and very close to the airport.

review.title: Didn't expect to be nickeled and dimed at a Hilton
review.reviewText: This hotel was lovely. The wait staff for room service was excellent. Our food always arrived very quickly and was delicious. The room was clean and had plenty of accommodations. However, we were charged $10 per day for internet use. This is OUTRAGEOUS. The Hilton hotel chain does not need to nickel and dime its customers in this way. It certainly does not cost them a penny extra to provide internet (which is significantly more important in 2013 than a TELEPHONE, which is free in every room). This is simple gauging and I find it reprehensible.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide FREE INTERNET for your customers. Charging for internet is outrageous.

review.title: 60th Birthday Adventure
review.reviewText:
My wife and I stayed here on my 60th birthday adventure, the first leg of three locations. We stayed for two nights, coming in around 1AM the first night. Our goal was to take the BART into San Fran and get a feel for the area since we had never been before. We took the free shuttle to and from the airport several times, and it was not a bad ride or too long.
On the van we met a nice couple from Utah, and instead of taking the BART we decided to share a ride on an airport limo instead, thinking we could save some time. It turned out to be a mistake, as it cost around $18 more and we loaded the van with around 6 more people, all who had to be dropped off at various hotels in San Fran. We took the BART back to the airport, and the total trip time from downtown to the hotel was around one hour or so.
The hotel is very nice, they served us free breakfast upstairs being Hilton Honors members, which would have cost around $20 if down in the restaurant. As others have said, nice grounds to walk around, and contemporary design to room.
Would stay again.

review.title: Better than expected...
review.reviewText: I'm a business traveler staying just one night. I booked online with an unpublished rate. When I found out which hotel it was, I read some of the reviews and became a little worried. Undeservedly so, it turned out. My room was great - stylish, clean, comfortable and roomy, with a fantastic view of the bay. Adequate pool and exercise room. Didn't check out the restaurant although it looked adequate. Hotel lobby decor is a little cheesy, but nothing too off-putting. Lame that you have to pay for internet, but that's Hilton policy, I think. Hotel staff was OK; when I called, front desk was a little aloof. Less than warm welcome when I arrived, but my room more than made up for it. I would stay here again - very comfortable and easy access to airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable room and the view of San Francisco Bay.
review.negativeRemarks: Service, paying for internet.
review.locationRemarks: Great location; less than 10 minutes to the airport.

review.title: Where is the bay view?
review.reviewText: internet connection slow and costly if you aren't a Hilton member. Pool too small for the size of the hotel. Restaurant too expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: location, internet connection and pool.
review.locationRemarks: Too far away from any local attractions, bay view from room limited to zero and limited of nearby and affordable places to eat.

review.title: Close to the airport with great amenities
review.reviewText: Good services with easy access to the airport via shuttle. Set in nice surroundings with access to the boardwalk for walking/jogging. The Burlingame trolley (shuttle) was a bonus and worth a try for something to do, offering transport to CalTrain and a good choice of shops and restaurants.

review.title: Nice meet up hotel for people flying through SFO
review.reviewText: It would have been a solid 5 but our bay view room actually faced a wall as do the first rooms on the side of the elevators. I had booked this expensive executive room as a special treat and paid extra for a view that was not really there except by standing in the corner.

review.title: Wi-fi ripoff
review.reviewText: Additional charge for wi-fi too high. Other wise OK.

review.title: Everything is paid/limited
review.reviewText:
Pros
- Location
- Bay is a walk away from the hotel

Cons
- No Dual sinks in two double bed room.
- $13 Paid parking per night.
- 30 minutes limit on computer use.
- $14-$16 movies
- No wi-fi
- Small Pool and jacuzzi design is a simple square in a corner.
review.negativeRemarks: No wifi - 30 minute limit on computer use - paid parking
review.locationRemarks: Good for someone that wants to be near the airport. Great walk to the bay right outside of the hotel.

review.title: Bad.
review.reviewText: The heating/AC unit was foul. It made the room smell like something had died in there. I actually switched rooms only to discover that the second room smelled just as bad. Even for an airport hotel this was a pretty poor experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Heating/AC unit. Terrible service.
review.locationRemarks: Location is fine. Convenient for quick travel to the airport.

review.title: Probably Better for Business not Family
review.reviewText: Front staff not so pleasant. If they are the first greeters they should be welcoming and friendly. Never ever saw this. Actually they were a little rude.
review.negativeRemarks: The front desk attendants, the room service food (old guacamole!), the unclean and little ventilation workout room. Dirty.

review.title: Disappointing and inaccurate advertising of room.

review.title: Love your dog, you'll love this Hilton!
review.reviewText: Our experience at Hilton is one of the best ever! As I always travel with Service Dogs, I often find hotels are off putting upon arrival. As I asked my son to put on our dogs vests the valet/porter insisted it was unnecessary since they are a dog friendly hotel. It is great! They have doggie bones in every size and waste bags at the Doggie Bar in the lobby. There is a pedestrian bridge off the lobby that takes you to a beautiful lagoon with walking path and much needed grass. We were favorably greeted by all employees and guests! Thank you Hilton for promoting such a positive environment for us!

review.title: Pleasantly surprised!
review.reviewText:
Having now stayed at all the SFO hotels, the Hilton Bayfront ranks right up there with the best. Our room was spacious and well kept up. The only item missing was a refrigerator, but that was just a minor consideration. The king sized bed was exceptionally comfortable and no one could ever complain about the lack of pillows!

We tried the hotel's restaurant for dinner and was pleasantly surprised. Both my wife and I had the filet mignon. Excellent!

All in all, the wait staff was exceptionally accommodating and friendly. We felt like honored guests, and that's not true for some of the other local hotels.

I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Hilton Bayfront near the San Francisco International Airport.

review.title: Friendly hotel and comfortable rooms
review.reviewText:
The staff was great. Even in the hallways the housekeeping staff was friendly and greeted us with a smile. The beds were comfortable and our room was always clean. There was easy access to the San Francisco Bay Trail nearby for a run/walk. The continental breakfast had good options.

The only cons were: 1) limited TV access, they did not provide AMC and we were looking forward to watching a program on that channel; 2) small pool and hot tub, it was always crowded and we were only able to use it one evening of our stay; 3) small area for the continental breakfast. It was also always crowded and should be expanded.

When the hotel engineer finally got my door open the manager offered me a free breakfast. Hardly compensation for being kept another 2 hours from sleep after travelling for so long. By this time it was midnight.
I still couldn't sleep because the antiquated sir conditioning came on and off very noisily all night long.

Hilton San Francisco Airport

review.title: Very nice surprise
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice; clean, spacious, friendly staff. The room was a surprise. The lines were roomy. By that I mean, there was no bulky furniture (no armors) taking up physical and visual space. The desk was very long...took the entire wall across from the bed. The bathroom had very good water pressure in the shower, and the toiletries were excellent. I had not used that brand before, and now I'm a fan. And the room service was the best I've had in a long time. I have discovered in my many years of travel, room service is usually just barely passable. This however, was quite good. I had clam chowder and Cobb Salad. I highly recommend both. In fact, I have already recommended this hotel to several of my friends and family who travel to San Francisco frequently. I will most definitely be a return guest.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the San Francisco airport. The shuttle service is very comfortable, and loops around every 20 minutes.

review.title: Romantic getaway close to airport
review.reviewText:
My boyfriend and I wanted to stay at a nice, romantic place convenient to the airport. The room was beautiful: clean, plush, and stylish. The only downsides to the room were that there was no fan in the bathroom and there weren't bathrobes. Everything else was great. The bed was really comfortable and the room wasn't cramped like a lot of hotels in this price range.

When we arrived, the front desk employee recommended we walk to the restaurant behind the hotel, Kincaid's, for dinner. So we walked a long a lovely, artfully lighted, waterside path to the restaurant and were delighted to find a beautiful steak and seafood restaurant. The food was as good as at some of the nicer seafood restaurants we've been to in Seattle. It was super classy and romantic, and we couldn't believe we were by the airport.

The staff was really helpful and nice. The room didn't have a fridge, but they held onto our leftovers in the kitchen fridge for us. When we lost our bag claim stub, they still found our bag and verified that it was the right one. The room service was very fast, great staff, delicious food. The bell staff and front desk employees were knowledgable, and service was immediate.

We were a little bit less impressed by the pool and hot tub, which felt pretty dungeony and didn't seem to have been updated. The hot tub was weird and felt like a fish farm tank...but it was hot and the chemicals weren't overwhelming, so as least we got a good soak in.

It was a great place to stay!

Overall I would give my stay at this hotel a 5. Decided to go for a late night swim in their indoor pool and was pleasantly surprised that we were not kicked out after their closing time of 10pm. Jacuzzi is not amazing but it was a great time. Rooms were clean bed was comfortable you get view of the lake pretty much good value for your buck. also conveniently close to all tourists attractions.

review.title: Look elsewhere
review.reviewText:
How can my overall rating be lower than the individual scores? Easy: the individual categories don't get to the heart of why I did not enjoy my stay. Our main problem with the hotel is that it looks and feels like it is at least 40 years old, from the exterior of the hotel to the interior of the rooms. The rooms were seriously depressing, and that doesn't come across in the pictures. The AC in the room is so loud that you can't sleep with it on.

Not sure why it is getting such decent ratings. If this was half the price, I guess it would be okay, but I think you can definitely do better somewhere else. Just look at some of the other hotels in the vicinity. The Hyatt for example looks much better, but I think it is also a bit more expensive.

review.title: Great Airport Hotel

review.title: Happy Traveler
review.reviewText: Great, clean, nice hotel would definately stay again.
review.locationRemarks: Great location easy drive to San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel by bay
review.reviewText: One complante charge for parking .if you do not need your car overnight park in airport parking. Same parking lot but ten dollars less.

review.title: Great for the price.
review.reviewText: The room was clean and pleasant. The staff was awesome. The pool was small and a little run down. It was not as expected.

review.title: Service was iffy, hotel was really nice.
review.reviewText: The hotel is a typical hilton- big screen tvs everywhere, marble and glass counter tops, etc etc. It's just so expensive for extras. Breakfast nears 20$ per person, and we sat there for probably 15min without getting a waitresses attention. Otherwise, a nice hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a quiet and safe area right next to the Bay trail with scenic view. For visitors who do not prepare to drive, the free airport shuttle is very convenient for connecting to BART and other public transport at the international terminal, the airport shuttle runs every 20 minutes and is very well managed. Our special thanks goes to Mr. Lau, who served on the afternoon session on 16 Aug 2012. He was very proactive in helping the guests and his recommendation of the Chinese restaurant nearby was indeed an excellent choice.

review.title: Positive experience at the Hilton
review.reviewText: Not much to complain about....shuttle service was timely, staff was okay, conditions were good for the Hilton name. If I needed to stay near the airport again and am unwilling to pay for a more expensive hotel, I might stay here.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for a bottle of water in the room. They could have offered one complimentary instead of charging.
review.locationRemarks: It's in a similar vicinity as several other airport hotels.

review.title: Far from to the city close to SFO
review.reviewText: I found the hotel quite convincing and decent, but be aware of implicit charges that may not show at the time of the reservation.
review.negativeRemarks: The Executive lounge and its continental breakfast was not something that fits a 4stars hotel!
review.locationRemarks: Is far from the down town, but if you want to go to the south the hotel is in a good spot.

review.title: Great night stay
review.reviewText: I liked everything about this hotel except the bathroom. It looked like they renovated the room and forgot the bathroom.

review.title: HIDDEN FEES
review.reviewText: Parking is $12.00 per night, i mean, they never mention that when you book your room or even when you are checking in. But you will receive the bill before you leave. And, Wi-Fi is not free either.

review.title: seminar traveler
review.reviewText: Great location to airport. I like that they have a shuttle to and from airport. Best view for an airport hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Had to take a cab to downtown
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: A mix of excellent features and a few annoyances.
review.reviewText: The Hilton is located where I wanted to be, had the best available rate in the area--which was surprising, given that there are others nearby that are (and were for this stay) typically less expensive, and is close to a Jewish deli (Max's) that I love. On the whole, my stay was very good and the windows were good enough to keep me from hearing both freeway and airplane noise. Nevertheless, there were a few things that I found strange or annoying, as follows: (1) the dinner menu was not to my taste (so I was pleased Max's is nearby), (2) the signage for how to get my car out of the hotel garage was awful, (3) the three TV screens displaying the same runway of women's fashions over and over again between the registration desk and the elevators is bizarre, (4) the AC in my room was quite loud, so I was pleased I had the silicone earplugs I always travel with along, which drowned it out completely, (5) there were no racks for hand towels--just hooks that the towels easily slipped off of, and (6) the maid, who was probably Chinese, spoke very, very poor English. However, I would stay there again, and I would recommend the hotel, if the room rate were similar to what I paid, over nearby hotels and motels.
review.positiveRemarks: The room rate, the location, the breakfast buffet, helpful staff, and Max's nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: See my detailed review above.
review.locationRemarks: For my needs, excellent.

review.title: I will be back for more!
review.reviewText: The location by the bay, the nice walk in the morning, the friendly staff ... The convenience of a shutlle to the airport, the free trolley ride to downtown Burlingame... Is just right for me.
review.positiveRemarks: Lovely location and the friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Lovely by the Bay

review.title: Great staff but hotel itself just ordinary
review.reviewText: Hotel staff accommodated me with a room even when fully booked and gave me free internet access. But the everything else was just "ok" not more, not less. If it were not for the staff I'd not recommend this hotel.

review.title: executive lounge rocks
review.reviewText: Booking a room with access to the executive lounge is the best deal. In the executive lounge you can get a continental breakfast, afternoon appetizers/snacks, and beverages all day long plus access to a computer and a wonderful view of planes landing.
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom not as modern as the room and smaller on size than other hotels

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Beautiful decor, disapointing view of parking lot. Concierge. lounge was nice and breakfast was fresh and good variety of fruits pastries and scrambled eggs etc. Complementary shuttle was useful. and staff was friendly. and knowledgable of area information. Menu at room. service. was unimaginative. d American. though. Overall. great. . Would stay again.

review.title: Comfortable night before a flight!
review.reviewText: Very conveniently located, a perfect place for a one night stay before a flight.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was updated and new and soundproof
review.negativeRemarks: The club level lounge appetizers
review.locationRemarks: Good location by the water.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: I rarely give out a perfect score. However, this staff was amazing, the grounds were excellent and my stay was very pleasant! Would recommend to anyone! The view was amazing as well of the back bay!
review.negativeRemarks: A little further from the airport then i thought, but the location and view made up for it! No airplane sounds at all!
review.locationRemarks: Amazing View, Great Staff, Moved my room with no issues at all, very friendly and clean!

review.title: Outstanding Hotel close to San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText:
From the moment I called for the airport shuttle everyone was pleasant and accommodating. The hotel is a bit on the older side, if you are not particular or concerned with outside appearances, the service you receive once you are inside is outstanding and makes up for everything else.

The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff is outstanding in every way! There is a shuttle to downtown Burlingame (which was complimentary)... overall I highly recommend this hotel if you are staying close to the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff is amazing! They are very accommodating and will go out of their way to help you.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to restaurants and the bay.

review.title: disappointed
review.reviewText: Unfriendly staff our first room smelled, we complained of shower not draining hotel staff said they would fix it never did. They decided to move us to different room which was much better. Hotel is not next to airport like stated.

review.title: Good hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel was good. Rooms clean, comfortable. Beds were extra plush, which was not good for me since I was experiencing back pain, but if it wasn't for that I would have been in heaven. Bathrooms were ok. The only negative thing I have to say for this hotel is that the indoor pool isn't great. First it is small. I was really looking forward to soaking in the jacuzzi but it was out of order and that area was roped off. The jacuzzi definitely needs repair because it was chipping bad. The pool was way too crowded for my taste, looked green to me, and smelled too much like chlorine. Location was good. Self parking is $18.

review.title: Maintains Hilton Standards

I rated the staff a little below 5 because I did try to contact the desk one time and no one responded--maybe they were super busy or did not want to be bothered with questions at that time.

review.title: Comfort!
review.reviewText: After staying in a dump the night before. The Bayfront Hilton was a pleasant respite from my travels. Yan at the front corrected a mistake that I made I in booking my room. I truly enjoyed my stay.

review.reviewText: Very noisy hotel. Everything from dogs barking in the hall at 1 am to the sound of the shower in the next room to the air conditioning.

review.title: Pleasent stay at the Hilton
review.reviewText: Good hotel. Tidy and clean. Staff were amazing. Executive suits are really good. You get what you pay for. There are safes in the rooms, cleaning service every day, and rooms are comfortable. Recommended. Free shuttles every 15 minutes TO and FROM the San Francisco international airport.

review.title: SF Airport Hilton coziness....
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, older decor but very comfy! Quick check in, easy to get to my room, conveniently located to the airport. The bar and restaurant were open till late, so I actually got some food when I needed it. An organic salad, which was great.

No free Internet in room is a disappointment. Easy access to freeway and airport. They charge you to park in hotel garage. Hotel has decent food.

review.title: Restful Refuge near San Fran Airport
review.reviewText: This hotel was exactly what we needed after a long travel day. A good r&r spot before moving in to San Fransisco or elsewhere in California.

review.title: excellent

review.title: Recommend driving travellers
review.reviewText: We drove to visit San Francisco from LA the weekend when there was a toot race in SF. To avoid the hassle of street closure and detour traffic, we decided to stay at a hotel outside SF, but close enough to drive into SF. Hilton at Burlingame meets our interest. It is only 20-25 mins drive on normal traffic and about 45 mins drive to SF downtown during Friday 5 pm. Room and bathroom are spacious and clean. Our room has a bay view and is quiet. Reception staff are friendly and helpful. Parking is $12 per day. Free Wi Fi available at lobby. We are overall quite pleased with our stay and found the rate more economical than staying at a 3 star SF downtown hotel. The only disappointment was there was no mini fridge for a Hilton hotel.

review.title: Hilton San Francisco Airport Bayfront

review.title: Good Hotel for Business Travelers

Shouldn't they check the rooms before it is assigned to a guest?

review.title: Quick trip to San Fran
review.reviewText:
We stayed at The Hilton on Airport Blvd for 2 nights. We were greeted upon arrival by a very friendly staff at the reception desk and check in was very quick. We went right to our room and it was very clean and comfortable. We were only in town for the 49er/Giant game therefore we didn't have much time to get into the city. We ate dinner both nights in the hotel and the food was excellent.
I'd stay in this hotel gain without question

review.title: San Francisco Airport Hilton Bayfront

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Everyone was pleasant and very helpful! We will definitely be back, one night wasn't enough.
review.locationRemarks: Location is ok, we were going into downtown San Francisco but the hotel contacted a taxi for us and it was very convenient.

review.title: Very Pleasant and clean

review.title: Excellent stay

review.title: Parking?

They use the lot of a nearby commercial building which is not too secure. Came back the last night of our stay and the police were searching for someone in the lot. Looks like the hotel is using their parking for long term parking for the airport? Did not eat at the restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Bay views with walking/jogging path on the bay.

review.title: Fine, but not quite
review.reviewText:
The hotel is fine, but that is it.
Relatively close to the airport.
Comfortable beds, but in old rooms, in good condition but with old layout of bathroom etc., not Hilton standard.
Internet did not work, and instead of fixing it, the hotel put me through to their service provider. 30 minutes on the phone and nothing...I gave up.
The breakfast buffet was fine and their restaurant staff very efficient, professional and friendly. The hotel just does not quite reach Hilton standards.
review.negativeRemarks: Terrible internet, no connection at al
review.locationRemarks: Not too far from the airport, there are shuttles, but taxis are close to 20 dollars.

review.title: Think twice befor you select it though it is close
review.reviewText:
Noisy heating old system in the room thought it is close to SFO airport.
We had $20 per person breakfast buffet,but it was not good. Overall experience is very poor.

review.title: Just Peach!
review.reviewText: I was so pleasantly surprised to find a hotel near an airport that was gorgeous, clean, with excellent service. No wonder there were several pilots staying there. The bed was divine. The TV was new and huge. The decor was gorgeous. The lobby was not boring beige. It was well designed with warm peach colored furniture and warm lighting. The lighting in the room was excellent. Every lamp had a dimmer switch so you could make each lamp dim or bright enough to read. I am sick of going to hotels where the fluorescent lamps are so dim you can't put make up on or read a book. I am an interior designer, and I must say this hotel had the BEST lighting in the rooms that I have ever seen. I am definitely going back. The breakfast was delicious, prepared quickly, and served with a smile. Finally a hotel chain gets it right! I arrived late from Hong Kong, and I went to the bar at 11:00 and ordered dinner and a glass of wine. Very reasonably priced, and comfortable for a single female traveler. The shuttle was right on time both to and from. 5 stars for this place! I slept like a baby.
review.locationRemarks: Burlingame.... safe, convenient.

review.title: good deal
review.reviewText: Very nice Hotel for the price.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, Room was fine. Had to ask for refrigerator. I feel I should not have to ask at the price per night paid. Bath could use updates such as wider tub and toilet positioned further from entrance to shower. Overall, better than average, view was OK, but wanted clearer view of the bay without office buildings in the way.
review.locationRemarks: Near airport, convenience.

review.title: Hilton Airport San Francisco
review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable. Check in was easy and quick. Shuttle took me right to the airport for free. I would definitely repeat.

review.title: Great for work!
review.reviewText: Really kind staff and very convenient shuttle to the Bart station.

review.title: Very pleased
review.reviewText:
Booked this as a 'Secret Saver' hotel, so had no idea what we were getting, apart from it being 4-star.
Very satisfied with everything about our stay (including the price we paid!)

review.title: Low Quality, not a Hilton!
review.reviewText:
Sheets were dirty on the first night, and torn on another day...
Internet service is soooo slow!!! can't make a simple Skype call over it! and they charge 12.95 for that per day!
Room heater is SO NOISY that really won't let you sleep, but without it - it is too cold...

However, the lounge on the top floor worth the additional $20 per day with 2 meals and cookies and fruits...

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: This is an old renovated property located about 3-4 miles from the airport in the middle of nowhere. Carpet in the room was dirty & disgusting.

review.title: Very expensive!
review.reviewText: Internet never worked and they charge for EVERYTHING!!! Internet, parking, water, etc...

review.title: Mixed experience
review.reviewText: I had mistakenly booked this hotel (thinking it was another). Although closer to the SF airport, the GPS sends you on a convoluted route to get to this out-of-the way place. Though located off the bay, my room was a real disappointment: it faced the parking lot with no water in sight. (Un)luck of the draw. The garage is detached from the hotel premises, necessitating a slight step outside to access the elevator. No card I was given (4 of them!) worked at the entrance gate, necessitating an awkward reversal up the ramp with the car (and two others waiting for entrance). My major complaint: internet was not free -- in a hotel of this size and prestige. It feels like the hotel is soaking the customer in this day and age. Other than all these inconveniences, the hotel is clean and comfortable but with a limited cable package.

review.title: Great Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed here one night in order to catch early morning flight out of SFO. All service staff were very friendly and efficient. Room was very clean, well appointed and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco Airport

review.title: Very happy
review.reviewText: No complaints

review.title: nice visit
review.reviewText: All in all hotel was great. no pool at the time we went.
review.locationRemarks: Like most of the city and surrounding areas. Was not to impressed with the wharf area.

review.title: Free airport shuttle, clean room
review.reviewText: I was in this room for approximately 6 hours before a flight, but it was clean, comfortable, and close to the airport. The airport shuttle was frequent, fast, and free! I would stay here again.

review.title: OK, nothing spectacular
review.reviewText:
Our 14th floor room was nice and clean, bed comfortable and the bathroom was large. Biggest complaint is the beeping of trucks in reverse starting about 530am on Sunday morning, which made the air traffic almost seem soothing in comparison. Pool was closed for renovation.

There is a decent diner very close to the hotel for a quick, relatively inexpensive meal, and access to the 101 freeway is excellent. This Hilton was nothing spectacular, but the rooms were clean, the service was attentive and overall we were happy.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: VERY nice stay with wonderful staff. Not much in the area, but the bar/restaurant was quite good. Highly recommend staying there.

review.title: Value and convience

review.locationRemarks: Half moon bay

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, although slightly pricey considering there is nothing but other hotels around.

review.title: Passable
review.reviewText:
Stayed for 3 nights, decent location close to sfo airport, parking was ridiculously expensive even by Hilton standards considering hotel was not in the city - room was small but alright, bathroom was spacious - but interestingly the shower knob was partially broken and someone had applied chewing gum to fix it. Surprisingly, the hotel maintenance staff did not bother to check it throughout our stay.

Room service breakfast was fairly ordinary. There was a small incorrect charge of $10 to our bill - in my hurry to check out early morning (had a 6 am flight) missed pointing out to the front desk. Oh well....

Decent enough hotel for a business traveler, not good for family or budget travel.

review.title: Great place near SF Airport
review.reviewText: Updated Hilton close to San Francisco Airport. Clean, friendly, quiet. Great walking/biking trail along the water just outside.

review.title: Good stop prior to early morning flight
review.reviewText: Just spent a short overnight in order to be near the airport for an early flight. Service was very good. They have a free shuttle running every 20 minutes and even recalled it for us when we missed departure by a few seconds. Room was clean and comfortable. Restaurant was well maintained; food not exceptional, but adequate for a hotel. I'd recommend this hotel and would use it again without hesitation.

review.title: Best hotel in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: We stayed at quite a few hotels in San Francisco and although it was away from the city, it was the most luxurious and comfortable hotel by far.

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is pretty consistent with the level of service and room any Hilton provides. My only complaint is that parking was an extra $ per day, and the staff didn't inform us of this upon check in. Staying longer than a few days this really adds up, all of the airport hotels may charge for parking. If I had to return I would call the hotels to get this info up front.

review.title: Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: As airport hotels go, only stay here when you can get a good deal on the room rate

review.title: Convenient to airport with nice bay view
review.reviewText: Room and hotel in general was pleasant with nice bay view. Room service was fast and food was good. Overall, we enjoyed our stay there.

review.title: Very friendly and Customer-centric
review.reviewText: Great!

review.title: Great San Fran Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hilton at Burlingame is a great night's stay. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable and the service is top notch. The only drawback is the location. Though the hotel is situated in a quiet place where one can easily walk down to the bay and walk by the water it is not that close to downtown San Francisco which is where most will be heading.

review.title: 30 minutes out of san fran

review.title: Fine airport hotel
review.reviewText: If you have an early morning flight with a free shuttle, this is easy and close.

review.title: Very Satisfied

review.title: great hotel to catch a flight

review.title: For a airport stay ok... but location not great
