review.title: Great night sleep!
review.reviewText: The hotel was nicely laid out, great food, comfortable beds and great temperature control...

review.title: Security staff response
review.reviewText:
Thirteen rude, unruly guests in the next room were evicted from the hotel by the security staff after we called the front desk to report repeated loud door slamming, loud voices and general obnoxious behavior after midnight. We heard one woman exclaim as she was escorted out "well, where are we going to go now, since everything else is closed".
Thank you to the front desk and security staff for a job well done and a peaceful night once those folks were gone.

review.title: Satisfied just a few complaints
review.reviewText: Great ambiance, great room with a view, great location (near airport and off 101 which can easily lead to sf attractions). The only major thing is that i specifically requested a room with a fridge for my baby's food and milk and they could not deliver on that part which was extremely disappointing. Also, parking isn't free, which sucks, too. But you can pay ahead and get a nightly "cheaper" rate.

review.title: Great hotel comfortable
review.reviewText: Near the sf area great location and view:)

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location close to SF Airport

review.title: Freds
review.reviewText: NA

review.title: Air Conditioning very loud
review.reviewText: The free airport shuttle was very convenient. They gave us a room on the 5th floor facing the air conditioning in the courtyard which was very loud. After complaining we got another room on the 13th floor. The noise wasn´t gone but still it was lots better there. The service was very friendly even though we complained about the room situation.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: It was near the airport, which we needed. The front lobby staff was very welcoming. They stored our golf clubs for us and got them out several times for us. The breakfast buffet was excellent. There was a good place to run near the ocean.

review.title: Excuse me ?
review.reviewText: First, let me start off by saying that the directions given to me were not even close to where the hotel was located. When we couldn't find the hotel, we did find another Hilton who then gave us directions, which also were no help. When we did finally find the hotel, I was asked if we had any trouble finding it. When I answered "Yes, I did", I received a look that I was obviously a moron and should go back to school. After that, several things occured that stuck out in my mind. We were never asked if we needed help with our luggage, and we were never asked if we needed or wanted to valet our car. When I needed to have my room keys reprogrammed (because they didn't work), I stood for at least five or six minutes waiting for someone to aknowledge me. And when we were swimming in the pool, some one (an employee) actually asked me if we were staying there. I've stayed in many 4 and 5 star hotels in my life, but I have never been made to feel as if I was "out of my league" before. I couldn't believe the apathy I (we) received during our stay. Someone needs a serious re-training in customer service.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Clean room and restaurant with beautiful view of the SF airport.

review.title: OK hotel, but had to pay for everything
review.reviewText: OK hotel, but paying extra for parking, breakfast and Internet access nearly doubled the price.

review.title: Great experience well looked after will go back
review.reviewText: We arrived in San Francisco after a twelve and half hour flight from NZ went through Immigration at airport walked out to the Shuttle Bus Stand and after5 min wait caught free Shuttle bus to The Hilton Bay View Burlingame. The check in staff were so friendly made us feel welcome great start. Our room was well up to expectation luxurious and clean. Used room service and when meals were delivered they would phone us to see if all was in order. We would certainly recommend this Hotel close to Airport and Bart rail to downtown free shuttle to Shopping at Burlingame. Would stay again.

review.title: Weekend of fun in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Had a great time. The hotel was awesome. We bought it thru Expedia and added breakfast. We had to go back and ask about the vouchers for breakfast but they gave us no problem about the two per room per day so it was good. The pool and spa are small but it was nice to have. Friendly staff and comfortable beds and nice tv. So close to the city but away enough from the noise of the city. Great stay for the low price!

review.title: San Francisco Airport location great and sound proof for great sleep
review.reviewText: This was the best airport hotel I ever stayed in. We could see the planes go over the top of the hotel but couldn't hear them at all. The breakfast in the restaurant was fabulous.

review.title: Great SF Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed one night to catch an early flight the next morning - friendly staff, clean and very comfortable room, wi-fi reception good, in-room dining good, shuttle service excellent. Only problem was the wake-up call facility, which is under maintenance, but I would have been late if I have not set my mobile phone as back-up.

review.title: Hilton San Fran Airport
review.reviewText: Pretty good stay. Very close to the airport but you don't hear the planes take off or land at all. The hotel is situated right next to a waterfront boardwalk and there is a great restaurant Kincaid's within a few hundred yards. Parking is fairly inexpensive, and the hotel staff was ver helpful. Only negative was that my same day laundry didn't come back to me as promised. I had to track it down myself for about one hour until they were able to get it back to me. For my troubles, they remove the parking charge. Overall, the hotel was very functional...

review.title: Awesome place to stay!
review.reviewText:
It was a pity to stay in this hotel for only a day.
I arrived at the hotel several hours prior to the check in time, but the hotel provided me with a room perfectly under my request.

review.title: Welcome to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Staying at the Hilton was wonderful. Service was excellent and the staff was friendly. I was impressed and enjoyed my stay. The rooms were clean, the sleep was quiet and the food was great.
Upper Marlboro, Maryland

review.title: Some improvement needed
review.reviewText: Overall enjoyed it. It was a little inconvenient that our room key never worked to enter and exit the parking facility, when we had to pay for it. The restuarant food was a little high, and our rooms did not have a refrigerator and/or microwave. We were also looking forward to your gift shop, that was not available. Rental movies are too high. The employees were awesome.

review.title: pretty good price in its class
review.reviewText: nice location, good price, clean room. everything was good.

review.title: Trip to Korea
review.reviewText: It would be nice if wireless didn't cost an extra $20

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: It is conveniently located because the public long term parking is just across the hotel. I like the ambience of the hotel .

review.title: Great Place to stay
review.reviewText: Rooms were excellent and the staff helpful and courteous. Was an excellent price for what you got.

review.title: Great for airport
review.reviewText: Great hotel with very frequent courtesy bus from airport. Staff were very helpful and explained the BART system to us saving us lots of money on taxi's and time

review.title: Good airport hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfect if you need to be close to the airport. For activities within San Francisco, it would be best if you stayed in a hotel in downtown San Fran or on Fisherman's Wharf. We stayed with friends the first three nights of our trip, and stayed here on the last night before we flew back home. Free shuttle to the airport was a nice touch.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was well priced and an excellent value. Its location on the bay gave acces to walking trails and the activity on the bay. The airport shuttle was on time and ran every 20 minutes. we would go back

review.title: Melissa
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely helpful and nice.

review.title: would stay there again
review.reviewText: hotel is very convienent

review.title: So-So
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel for its location close to SFO and the free shuttle service. Other than that I didn't have high expectations. But the first room the front desk clerk assigned to us had dirt stains on the carpet and was right above the extremely loud air conditioning unit of the hotel. Which was an interesting way of trying to meet my request, since I had specifically asked for a quiet room. After asking for another room, I had to go and pick up the key myself. The next room was much cleaner and less noisy but overall I would not recommend this hotel due to the bad service.

review.title: Great airport hotel
review.reviewText: The airport is about 5 minutes away, and the view to the Bay is lovely. Decent fitness center and heated indoor pool (and the supposed hours of the pool are quite flexible, so I could get in an early-morning swim before heading to the airport @ 5:30am).

review.title: Excellent Staff quickly responding to your request. Make you feel very welcomed and want to return.
review.reviewText: You could tell the place had been updated to make the room feel very modern. The staff promptly fullfilled every request . You had the feeling that you were really welcomed and they made you feel important to them as a customer. In particular, I misplaced a bag and was frantically looking for it 3 hours before my flight. They checked the airport shuttle we came on, looked in their and the hotel's lost and found, called lost and found at the airport , and put in a follow up plan if they found it later. I was very impressed with the response to my panic. Free local calls, free internet access, free shuttle transportation to and from the airport were big pluses for us. The swimming pool was small, but the water was very warm and comfortable to swim in. This made our swim in the morning very enjoyable. My wife said we should stay whenever we come back to San Francisco again. And I would recommend the Hilton to anyone who would as me.

review.title: Expensive Breakfast
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, but the breakfast was expensive.... and no free internet.

review.title: Ed
review.reviewText: Clsoe to S.F. but not as crowded

review.title: Traveler's resting place
review.reviewText: We love the beddings and large puffy pillows, so comfy and resting... The new large screen TV, so nice to have to enjoy the beautiful sunny room when not going out. It is a very nice air port hotel, so quiet....

review.title: Very good to stay next to the airport.
review.reviewText: Very good to stay next to the airport.

review.title: Great service, friendly people, good restaurant
review.reviewText: I'm very impressed with this Hilton and stay there often. It's quiet, convenient, and the restaurant is strong on service

review.title: Nice Airport Hotel
review.reviewText:
Convenient location.
Good restaurants in Burlingame at the other side of 101.
Nice lobby.
Large parking lot but expensive.
Shower is good but shower head could deliver more water.

review.title: Convinient hotel near to the airport
review.reviewText: If you need to stay overnight to catch a flight the next day this is a good option. I had the morning to explore the surroundings and even if there is not much to see arround but hotels you can take a nice promenade in a public shore trail. There is a free shuttle to the airport, but allow sometime for pick ups and drop offs.

review.title: I will always choose this airport hotel in SFO
review.reviewText: I have stayed at four other hotels at SFO and thi is the only one I would return to.

review.title: Very nice, clean hotel.
review.reviewText: Very nice accommodations. Room was very clean. Staff seemed nice and helpful. Would definately stay there in the future.

review.title: The Perfect San Francisco Stay
review.reviewText: When you go to San Francisco for an emergency medical procedure and end up there for 24 days, you soon find hotel choice and comfort become very important. We had stayed in a couple of other hotels before we found the gem that is the Hilton San Francisco Airport hotel. It is close to the airport, yet far enough from the hustle and bustle of downtown San Francisco. It sits right on the bay for a relaxing atmosphere. It became our home away from home and a sanctuary for our souls. The room was amazing, the staff even more incredible. We actually got to know them from our extended stay..and they treated us like family. Our family also came to stay there and loved it as well. It has a free shuttle to the airport and to the Burlingame shopping district. It is close to Caltrain which was our primary means of travel in and out of the city. The price was very reasonable compared to the downtown hotels and in my opinion is actually a better deal. I recommend this hotel completely and will if I ever find myself in the bay area, stay again without a doubt.

review.title: Dirty, seedy hotel stuck in the 70s
review.reviewText: I have no idea why this hotel has such good reviews. Disgusted from the minute I arrived to the minute I left. Nobody told me I had to pay an extortionate deposit for every night & it's the first hotel I've known make such a big deal of it. Front desk staff & manager were incredibly rude & made us feel unwelcome. Hotel was hideous! You really wouldn't know it'd been refurbished. It's trapped in a 70s time warp & everything was as battered as if it really had been around since the 70s. Corridors are like a prison. Don't think the bathroom had been cleaned, there were marks on toilet seat & overflow was moudly. Bath so old the bottom was black. Valance sheets on the beds were covered in stains. Stains on furniture, walls & unrequested connecting door. Maid clearly hadn't dusted anywhere she thought people wouldn't notice. This is the noisiet hotel I've ever stayed at, the noise from the airport was unbelievable & doors & walls were so thin I could hear everything from every direction. Sleep was impossible and beds uncomfy. Paid for a bay view but had to crane my neck to see further than the airport car park & dirty lake. The pool's tiny, claustrophobic & dirty. Burlingame shuttle's good but only runs 11:47-7:51. I was here for the Shoreline Amphitheatre & the only reason I stayed here was because the reviews are so good. So I was miles away from what I came for in a disgusting hotel I didn't want to be in. It's nothing like its pictures & I'd never recommend it to anybody.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: it is great located near the airport, and the courtesy shuttle is excellent!!

review.title: Clean and comfortable!
review.reviewText: My kids and I had a wonderful time staying at the Hilton San Fran Airport hotel! The room was always spotless during the day, and quiet at night. We had the breakfast buffet one morning and it was great. If we come to San Fran again, we'll definitely stay here.

review.title: Leaking water
review.reviewText: Checked in and put my bags on the floor by the bed & closet. Hopped into the shower and when I got out to grab my clothes, they were all soaked. The water was leaking through the walls somehow and got my carpet all wet. Mentioned it to the front desk on the way out and they didn't apologize. They just said they'd take care of it. If it weren't for that issue alone the experience would have been much better.

review.title: Hotel with great view
review.reviewText: The hotel was adjacient to walking trails along San Francisco Bay. We were a short walk from a terrific steak house and close to the airport. Fun to watch the planes land and take-off. Room was updated, well-organized and very comfortable.

review.title: Four Stars Hotel
review.reviewText: Its a HIlton hotel, so you expect nice room and great service.

review.title: ok
review.reviewText: ok
review.userLocation: Sao Paulo, Brazil / Colorado Springs, CO

review.title: Good value hotel
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, well priced, breakfast OK.

Airport location means you either need a car or you don't need to do anything except be in the hotel.

Internet access in the lobby useful.

review.title: Relaxing Stay
review.reviewText: This Hilton was quite nice. The beds were extremely comfortable and the pillows were the best! The best part of the hotel is the lounge on the top floor, available only to those that book the top floor suites. This place was great. Big TVs, breakfast, snacks, computers. Other than this I did not like how many things cost extra, such as a microwave or a fridge, or parking.

review.title: Fine hotel and proximity to San Fran airport w/ free airport shuttle
review.reviewText: Hotel and room were fine....bed was comfortable and liked that checkout wasn't early in the morning. Had an afternoon flight and was able to sleep in and catch shuttle to airport. Definitely recommend staying there enroute to airport. Nice view too.

review.title: Would return because of hotel staff.
review.reviewText: Hotel was a surprise based on price-exceeded expectations. The staff was very professional.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Good experience with a very clean and professionally maintained hotel.

review.title: Excelent hotel and service
review.reviewText: No complaints

review.title: Don't mind using same hotel in the future!
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to the freeway to get you to the various landmarks. You need a car to go other restaurants if you want to try other food specialties.

review.title: Great Hotel Airport
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located relative to the SF airport. It was comfortable, beautiful, and clean.

review.title: good hotel, but something far
review.reviewText: the hotel is nice but the services are very expensive, the parking and the taxi service are very expensive, Other than that, the hotel offers good service and pleasant stay.

review.title: Hilton SF Hotel
review.reviewText:
- The hotel is not located at a convenient location, getting on the highway is very painful
- The parking is charged at an exorbitant rate and the rules are crazy
- It is not well equipped to do room service
- Not at all kids friendly
- No Wifi

review.title: Airport Hilton, San Francisco
review.reviewText: I needed to stay near the Airport in SF. The Hilton worked out quite well. Was not pleased by the daily parking fee of $18.00. However the price was right. Had breakfast vouchers for the buffet which was fine except for the scrambled eggs which were in the chafing dish. However, the breakfast staff was willing to scramble eggs fresh for me at no extra charge which was really nice. The room was well equipped. I was there 5 nights. 4 of the days, the room was well serviced. One day was a little less so. But, would stay again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!!!
review.reviewText: The room was of course nice and we had a nice view of the city. The hotel itself was only 12 minutes from downtown which was very convenient! Napa Valley is only 50 minutes away if you would like to go to wine country.

review.title: Happy to recommend
review.reviewText: Hotel, well located to SFO, quality comfort, easy to shuttle between airport. Not as convenient to most attractions, approx $50 taxi each way.

review.title: Hilton San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: Overall experiences, very suitable to stay in above Hotel.

review.title: Great for business
review.reviewText: Great hotel for quick business trips to the city. Airport access very close. Staff very friendly. Gift shop personnel VERY helpful and great people skills!

review.title: Hotel was very convenient to get to from the Airport.
review.reviewText: We both had a wonderful time. The service was great as well as the friendliness of the service personnel. The buffet breakfast was wonderful. We happened to stay at the Hilton on our return trip on Saturday night.

review.title: Good Place to Stay
review.reviewText: It's nice place to stay for business or leisure.

review.title: Good price, good hotel
review.reviewText: I was satisfied with the price, room and location.

review.title: Not impressed for the price, front desk wasn't that helpful.
review.reviewText: The beds were not premium mattresses (average), though pillows were comfortable. The shower was completely messed up and backwards on all the fixtures; the showerhead sprayed in all directions and wasn't very powerful. When I called the front desk because we couldn't find the hotel, the clerk gave us minimal directions and then hung up on us. We couldn't leave to go to dinner easily, because the girl at front desk forgot to program our card to leave the garage.

review.title: A good business location
review.reviewText: The hotel is convinient to the airport, and allows you to travel easliy North to San Francisco or south to San Jose or across the bridge to Oakland without too much aggravation. The hotel is clean and efficient and is easily accessible from the highway.

review.title: Absolutely wonderful
review.reviewText:
From the receptionists to the maids to room service, service was impeccable. Everything was clean. Nothing appeared worn or broken, with the exception of perhaps a drawer on one bureau. I had a great view out my window. I have no complaints about this hotel.

I did witness one very vocal rude guest arrive on the shuttle who complained about the non-smoking facility: that she always stayed in Hilton Hotels; she always stayed in a smoking room; she always had a king-size bed. The staff handled the situation very well, despite the guest being so incredibly obnoxious.

I would stay at this hotel again.

review.title: hilton sfo
review.reviewText: decent place to stay in terms of airport hotels. no free breakfast - only downfall

review.title: Dissatisfied
review.reviewText:
While the room is spacious, the bed comfortable and there was a large flat screen TV , I could not get the TV to work without calling the desk for help. In the morning I could not operate the shower handle. There was not time to obtain assistance for that problem, so I could not shower.

At check out when I advised of the shower problem the clerk waived my modest dinner charge, estimated at $16.00, but I do not think that waived charge compensates for lack of a shower before a day of traveling.

I would hesitate to stay there again.

review.title: avarage
review.reviewText: good price for a hilton

review.title: satisfying overall
review.reviewText:
I stayed at hilton for one night and except the inconvenience of its location,
I really liked it. It took me longer than I expected from SFO to the hotel by cab.
And the only view I could enjoy from my window was a parking lot. lol
But the service was very nice and the restaurant was also good. The room was also very clean and the bathroom is a bit bigger than other hotels at same price range. I would definitely choose the hilton if I go back to San Francisco.

review.title: Good Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice airport hotel. Staff is very helpful and courteous. Airport shuttle is convenient. First time visiting SF and I wished it was easier to access the BART. If you have no rental car...it's tough to get around SF on public transportation alone especially staying at a hotal near the airport. But its good for the price and overall, satisfied but would of pick a closer Hilton hotel location.

review.title: Verygood overnight place.
review.reviewText: Glad I chose the Hilton for overnight between SFO flights. Shuttle was available at airport curb, hotel check-in quick, and room clean, roomy, quiet, nice view of Bay, room service was good as promised, checkout quick and caught early shuttle in morn.

review.title: Nice room, but who pays for parking?
review.reviewText:
I flew in to SFO late one evening for a business meeting the following day. I rented a car. From the "on airport" car rental location it took 30 minutes and two stops to get directions at other airport hotels to find the Hilton.

I checked in for a one night stay. I was told to park my rental car in the adjacent parking deck, using my room key for deck entrance.

The room key didn't open the gate into the parking deck. With cars in line behind me, I pulled a "public parking" ticket from the dispenser, opened the gate, and drove into the deck. I figured I would the straighten the matter out when I checked out the next morning.

My room was excellent, very tastefully decorated . Excellent bed, excellent desk, excellent lighting and sufficient electric outlets for the computer and other items carried by the business traveler. Very quiet. Bathroom was okay. The vanity was nice but the tub/shower befit a hotel of lesser quality. Expect to pay the typical, obnoxious internet access fee one finds at higher end hotels.

Upon checkout I explained the parking deck snafu to the front desk staff. I was told I should not have pulled the public ticket. My room key would open the parking deck exit gate the clerk explained, so the parking charge would remain on my bill.

The key didn't open the gate. I had to pay the public parking fee to exit the deck.
Why pay for parking, much less twice. You don't pay for parking at airport hotels closer to SFO and easier to find (Hampton Inn).

review.title: Comfortable Hotel Near SFO
review.reviewText: The hotel room had very comfortable bedding and was quite convenient for our pre-early morning flight stay. We got to SFO without a hitch and well rested at that.

review.title: HSFA
review.reviewText: Quite pleasant and professiona;. No continental breakfast but great service at the restaurant.

review.title: Great but no place to hang towels
review.reviewText: The hotel room was elegantly remodeled. Looked great and was comfortable. No towel racks, just 2 towel hooks (1 for bath towel; 1 for hand towel). There was a table for the clean towels. We had to have new towels each day.

review.title: Best night sleep ever
review.reviewText: Best service. Friendly employees. Clean. Great restaurant. Great rate for new years eve.

review.title: San Francisco Hilton Airport
review.reviewText: Very good hotel and presentation, and great service.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: friendly

review.title: Nice hotel near SFO
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Executive floor. It provided free lounge to have rest. Nice view, free snacks, and it's very confort.

review.title: The best airport hotel I have ever been in...
review.reviewText: We had a one night stay prior to an early next morning flight to Honolulu. Sheraton has hit a homerun with this hotel. It appears to be brand new, the place is immaculate and very modern. The staff provides 5-Star professional level service. The shuttle was fast with and efficient and only made one other stop before reaching the airport. The room was large and tastefully appointed. There is absolutely nothing wrong with hotel. We will be staying here again.

review.title: Excellent experience
review.reviewText: Highly recommended for anyone staying in the vicinity

review.title: Affordable Stay near Airport
review.reviewText:
Stayed at the hotel on business at the end of Oct 2009. Quick check in with clean, comfortable room with great TV, and fantastic bed/linen. Surrounding area very industrial but close to airport with good shuttle service. Only real problem was the loud slam of closing doors from neighbouring rooms. Need to fix that. Otherwise very pleased with stay and price.
Thank you.

review.title: For a Hilton, I expected more...
review.reviewText: I guess it was our fault for not checking into it further, but parking was $18 a night. WHEW! From what I gathered that was pretty standard practice, but we've done a lot of traveling and parking has always been gratis. The location was nice, not too far from the city, but far enough that the hustle and bustle was stifled a bit. Our room had a really nice view and was very comfortable and clean. We had a bit of a problem with the breakfast buffet. It was just ok...for the price, we expected a bit more and have had better buffets at Holiday Inns. Not only that but the server, who only brought us drinks, critized our generous 15% tip (for a buffet!) right in front of us. We brought this to the attention of the manager, who kinda brushed it off and offered no compensation. Disappointed, and we will most likely not be staying again when we visit SF.

review.title: Good Value For the Price Paid
review.reviewText: A little out of the way (from downtown SF) but if you have a vehicle it's not too bad. Staff were courteous and helpful.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Excellent value

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: enjoyed my visit, however we arrived late at night and the shuttle bus was not running so we took a taxi which took us to the Hilton Garden Inn. We then had to take another taxi to the Hilton costing ua over $50.00 in fares. Please print the no. for the shuttle so people can call for it to come.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel was very nice but the gentlemen that was tending bar was not real friendly.

review.title: Noisy Night
review.reviewText: My sleep was disrupted twice during the night with people in the hallways screaming obscenities at each other, pounding on the walls, and making a terrible racket. Never again.

review.title: Hilton San Francisco Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: It was a good decision to stay in the Hilton San Francisco Airport. Excellent service, attention and restaurant. The free transportation from and to the airport is a must. We went to the airport to take the train to downtown and visit all the places there and the "embarcadero" without the worries of traffic or parking. The man in charge of tours and information was very courteous and nice. I recommend this hotel.

review.title: Very comfortable beds
review.reviewText: The check in went smooth, when we got to our rooms very pleased they were very clean. Also, I had never sleeped in such comfortable bed in a hotel. I would stay there again.

review.title: Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: This hotel provides a clean, comfortable room with a nice view of San Francisco Bay. There is one casual restaurant/bar that is sufficient for a quick meal. The hotel seemed mostly empty when I was there, but it was a very pleasant place to stay for the night. There is a nice walking/running path along the bay that is adjacent to the hotel.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: a nice hotel near de airport

review.title: Newly re-furbished!
review.reviewText: Almost like walking into a new hotel, due to recent renovation. Only thing they need to change is their airport service phone message, which notified me that my hotel was "closed for extensive renovation." Recommended!

review.title: One of the Best
review.reviewText: I loved our stay at the Hilton. Everyone was so helpful and the service was the best. I would definitely choose this hotel again and would recommend it to people that don't mind being away from downtown. This hotel is one of the nicest I have ever stayed at.

review.title: great for airport hotel
review.reviewText: We were surprosed to find that Hilton had purchased the Sheraton Gateway. The room that we were assigned was bare bones. The bed was comfortable and there was an airport shuttle which is what we required. The Chicken Panini at the resterant was terrible and so dry. They made no apologies or attempt to correct the problem.

review.title: Great Hotel, but problem with parking gate
review.reviewText: We booked when this hotel was a Sheraton. We stayed in about 4 years ago and loved it. This trip was for our honeymoon and we knew where we wanted to stay. When it got changed to a Hilton a week before our trip, we were a little worried but no problems with reservation. The hotel was great! The only problem we had was with the parking gate. You use the hotel room card key and it kept reseting the codes. I am a technology person and it was just not reading the cards. We had to go in EVERY DAY and have the cards re coded. BIG SET BACK. Staff was alright, hotel was very clean, and the room was great, and quite.

review.title: quiet room w/a view.....
review.reviewText: We stayed only one night at the hotel. They had our booking information wrong and tried to charge us an additional fee for the room we had already prepaid for. The matter was easily cleared up and we were given a nice quiet room.Room service was excellent and the breakfast buffet was great. We had our children with us and the nature walk along the bay was perfect for them to get out their energy!! We really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: nice hotel with easy access to airport
review.reviewText: We only stayed here because we needed to be at the airport early the next morning. Easy shuttle service, nice rooms, good price thru expedia and will definitely stay here again. Only complaint is that these large chain hotels still want to charge $11/day for Internet, when all the discount hotels are offering WiFi for free. These big hotels need to stop nickle and diming the business travelers on the Internet services.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: The hotel had sold out of rooms so they were nice enough to upgrade me to the club level. I have been in other club level and usually on that level you get free drinks in the lounge on the floor. Other than that I cannot complain. The staff was very friendly and accomodating.

review.title: Sheraton (airport Hotel)
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel prior to our early flight the following day back to the east coast. We had a nice room with water view. Room service was good as was the service at the lounge downstairs. We were able to use the shuttle at 4:00am to the airport and our driver even produced two cups of coffee while we waited to go to the airport when we asked it of him. Overall very pleased with the choice to stay here prior to our flight.

review.title: Parking Problem
review.reviewText: The only problem we had was trying to park on the weekend. We had to park across the street. However, we did get the parking reimbursed two nights when we were only inconvenienced one night.
